programme.desc: Coverage of today's meeting at Wolverhampton.(n)

programme.title: Stateside
programme.desc: Live coverage from the United States.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: The Andrew Marr Show
programme.desc: Round-up of the week's stories, featuring interviews with key figures in politics and current affairs, and leafing through the Sunday papers. Including news and weather at 9.00.(n)

programme.title: The Big Questions
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell presents moral and religious discussions on topical issues from St Edward's School, Oxford.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Politics London
programme.desc: The week's events at Westminster, presented by Andrew Neil. Including news and a regional round-up.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion presents as the hunt for bargains heads to the Brackley Antique Cellar, Northamptonshire, where two teams of best friends call upon the services of experts Charlie Ross and Catherine Southon to help them find three items in an attempt to make profit at auction. Christina also takes time out to look at some watches through the ages.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Antiques experts Charlie Ross and Thomas Plant peruse a selection of the public's potentially valuable items on a visit to the Fleet Air Arm Museum at HMS Heron in Yeovilton, Somerset. Meanwhile, host Paul Martin travels to Forde Abbey, which was once home to Cistercian monks, and meets a family who have inherited a religious heritage that influences their everyday lives.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: Jules Hudson investigates why native bluebells in the UK are threatened with extinction and Keeley Donovan discovers people who experience spring in a truly multi-sensory way.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A budding writer and her husband seek a new home in the Worcestershire countryside on a budget of £375,000. Plus, Nicki Chapman meets a craftsman preserving local equine traditions.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: David Grant presents a special episode for Mothering Sunday, meeting a boxing coach helping her community and a foster mother who has taken in three asylum seekers from Afghanistan.(n)

programme.title: Shop Well for Less
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Steph McGovern are in Surrey, where a year ago part-time teacher Flo took some time out to look after the couple's children, aged four, five and six - but her love of socialising means she regularly goes into her overdraft. Meanwhile, her petrolhead husband John has an expensive hobby, buying various spare parts and paying for a second garage. How will the couple feel when some of their favourite products are taken away? Plus, a group of campers test different canopies and Avi Shankar reveals how early children can be influenced by advertising.(n)

programme.title: Comic Relief 2017
programme.sub-title: The Best of Red Nose Day.
programme.desc: A compilation of the best moments from the 2017 fundraising event, featuring Alan Partridge, People Just Do Nothing, Toast of London and the return of Smack the Pony.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: This week's show comes from Denbighshire, where Matt baker meets one of the country's most successful sheep farmers while Ellie Harrison observes the spring mating rituals of grouse and goes in search of adders on the moorland. Sean Fletcher meets an artist who makes edible flowers, Adam Henson visits a college in Cumbria that provides a sheepdog training course, and Tom Heap examines the future of British farming. Including weather for the week ahead.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Burton Constable Hall near Hull, which is home to a collection of treasures. Objects brought in to be valued include a ship's anchor that was found in a garden pond, a medal awarded to sailor for helping to recover Captain Scott's ship from the Antarctic in 1901, some 17th-century flat pack furniture, and a flimsy booklet that proved to be a profitable investment.(n)

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: New series. Thandie Newton stars in the fourth instalment of the crime drama as a detective on the trail of a serial killer. She is determined to catch the culprit as soon as possible and prove her worth to her superiors - but a colleague fears her efforts may have led to a miscarriage of justice, and alerts the AC-12 team to the situation.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 3
programme.desc: The armoured avenger hunts for the mastermind behind an untraceable series of bombings, despite being cut off from his usual resources and traumatised by a recent brush with death. His search uncovers a secret conspiracy involving a drug that renders the user indestructible. Superhero adventure sequel, starring Robert Downey Jr, Gwyneth Paltrow and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: The Apprentice USA
programme.sub-title: The Celebrity Apprentice USA: One of Us Will Win but Not by Much.
programme.desc: The candidates continue the ice cream-based challenge before the overall winner is decided. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Holding Back the Years
programme.desc: New series. Maureen Lipman is the first of five celebrities reflecting their experiences of growing old, travelling to her home town of Hull to hear ways people avoid loneliness.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore a semi in Talke Pits, Staffordshire, a detached home in Littleover, Derby, and a small piece of land in Earlsfield, south-west London.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Officers in Amsterdam search for a Liverpool drugs baron, while the Metropolitan police are hunting down two American brothers who fled the US while awaiting trial.(n)

programme.title: Fake Britain
programme.desc: Matt Allwright learns how a man has taken it upon himself to track down lethal counterfeit booze after his 23-year-old daughter was fatally poisoned by fake gin. Plus, the presenter reveals the extraordinary levels of food forgery across the UK.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Gary Pe and Danny Sebastian help two teams search for items at the Westpoint Arena in Exeter, while presenter Natasha Raskin learns about the history of weaving in Axminster.(n)

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A desperate Emma goes too far in trying to forget her troubles, and Daniel mocks Zara when she tells him she is going to try a new approach with patients.(n)

programme.title: The Code
programme.desc: Three Bath University friends answer questions to help crack a three-digit code that will open a safe full of money. Matt Allwright hosts, with expert help from Lesley-Anne Brewis.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A London couple search West Sussex for properties within their £1.1million budget. Nicki Chapman is their guide, and also goes bell-ringing at Chichester Cathedral.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms three items reclaimed from a tip in Witley, Surrey with screen printer Daniel Heath given the task of making a wooden tea trolley desirable again.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Nick Davies are in Reading, Berkshire, to value items including 19th-century French paperweights, while presenter Paul Martin visits Cliveden House.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: The first visit of the week to the One Show studio, where Matt Baker and Michelle Ackerley present the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: A report on the events of last Wednesday, when Khalid Masood drove his car at pedestrians on Westminster Bridge before fatally stabbing PC Keith Palmer in the Palace of Westminster.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Michelle reaches breaking point as she grows increasingly jealous of Preston and Bex's relationship, and suggests to a confused Martin that the teenage American might not be right for his daughter. However, things soon reach a head at the Carters' latest theme night, where Michelle's secret looks set to explode. Meanwhile, Tina is thrown when she learns social services are coming to assess Sylvie tomorrow, and Kush supports Denise after only a few people turn up for her community meeting - and the pair are soon struggling to resist each other.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: An audience in Birmingham is given a chance to have a say at a hugely significant moment in British history, with the Government about to trigger Article 50 and start the process of leaving the European Union after the win for the Leave campaign in the vote held on June 23 last year. David Dimbleby hosts this special edition of the programme, which gives members of the public the chance to put questions about the implications of Brexit to a panel of senior politicians from both of the EU referendum campaigns.(n)

programme.title: All Round to Mrs Brown's
programme.desc: Mrs Brown's Boys creator, writer and star Brendan O'Carroll dons Agnes's famous cardigan and curlers once again, throwing open the doors of the larger-than-life Irish matriarch's home to host a Saturday night chat show, filmed in front of a live studio audience. She begins by inviting actress Pamela Anderson, tennis coach Judy Murray and entertainments manager and TV personality Louis Walsh, among others to join her in the sitting room.(n)

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You.
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Phil Wang and broadcaster Janet Street-Porter joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the week's news stories.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks at subjects beginning with the letter I, continuing her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture. Along the way, she gets inspiration and advice from some of the BBC's most popular gardening presenters.(n)

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.sub-title: The Wheel Has Come Full Circle.
programme.desc: It is a busy time for many as Easter approaches, with Jo Birch getting popular attraction La Seigneurie Gardens ready for the start of the tourist season. Shepherd Dave Scott is bracing himself for the onset of lambing and Bas needs to get his fishing boat painted in time, but a blizzard and a force-nine gale throw many plans into disarray.(n)

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
programme.desc: Armed with a long-standing interest in Zen Buddhism, Monty Don takes his globe-trotting tour to the Orient, where he investigates two very different approaches to gardening in China and Japan. His research leads him first to China's ancient scholars' gardens in Suzhou, and after gaining a new insight into oriental horticulture, he journeys to Kyoto, the Japanese city of gardens.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty starts his plans for his revamped courtyard garden, when he plants bare root trees and gives advice on climbers that will happily grow on east-facing walls. Nick Bailey explores the strange world of lichens and finds out how these plants grow and thrive on trees, wood and stone, while Frances Tophill meets the enthusiastic gardeners of Barbados who fill their gardens with colour, foliage and world class flowers. As part of the programmes 50th Anniversary, Flo Headlam reveals the plant she thinks has had the most impact on British gardens over the last half-century. Including weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Anita Rani present the show from the Hoo Peninsula, reporting on the influence of the local `salt shepherds' and efforts to protect the birds that flock to the area. Plus, there are new arrivals on Adam Henson's farm, and Tom Heap reveals what Britain leaving the EU will mean for the country's migrant labour force and the farmers who employ them.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater: Eating Together
programme.desc: The food writer takes a culinary tour of Britain. Starting with old-fashioned suet dumplings, he travels to Lincolnshire to try some pea kachori and lamb samosas that have a profound personal significance. Nigel then meets a man from Poland to learn the art of Pierogi making, as well as a woman whose traditional ravioli keeps a little bit of Italy alive for her family in Bedford.(n)

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson demonstrates dishes that combine the comfort of the familiar with the excitement of the new, including fluffy oat pancakes drizzled with a raspberry and honey syrup. She offers a twist on a classic Caesar salad for a light lunch idea, and rustles up a Greek-inspired supper for friends including squid and orzo pasta, and a sweet and savoury version of a cheesecake. Nigella's simple rice bowl with ginger, radish and avocado celebrates a few choice ingredients and results in a dish that's uplifting to look at, as well as to eat.(n)

programme.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
programme.desc: Two friends lead double lives, adopting an alternative identity when it suits their purposes, but both tricksters come to realise their duplicity is about to jeopardise their romantic endeavours. Comedy, based on Oscar Wilde's stage play, starring Michael Redgrave, Michael Denison, Edith Evans, Margaret Rutherford, Dorothy Tutin and Joan Greenwood.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore transforms and then sells three things about to be dumped at a tip in Witley, Surrey, before giving the profits to the people who were getting rid of them.(n)

programme.title: The House That £100K Built
programme.desc: Kevin and Lesley have lived on the Isle of Sheppey for over a decade and have longed for the perfect home in their dream location, and have decided to design an eye-catching house that echoes the nearby seaside. Elsewhere, farmers Sue and Tim complete the interior work in their ambitious cantilevered home, which has been an on-going project for around nine years.(n)

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: The Black Forest to Hannover - Part Two.
programme.desc: Michael Portillo ventures into the Black Forest to discover the essence of Germany, and att Goettingen he discovers two sides of student life at the turn of the 20th century.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Land with Kate Humble
programme.desc: The presenter follows innovative businesses in the Lake District through Spring, Summer and Autumn, painting portrait of the rugged landscape and gaining an insight the challenges they face. Kate Humble helps with lambing at a fifth generation farm who have invented the world's only wool compost, so they can keep their farming traditions alive. She also goes foraging for wild food, which went to waste until one woman realised she could turn it into unique jams and preserves that are now sold nationwide.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Highlights of the IAAF World Cross Country Championships, the 42nd staging of the event, which this year was held in Kampala, Uganda. Kenya won both senior titles two years ago, but were knocked off the top of the medal table for the first time in five editions by Ethiopia, who captured 11 medals in total. British hopes rested with the inaugural staging of the mixed relay, an 8km race contested by teams of two men and two women.(n)

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace explores the largest bicycle factory in Britain which produces 150 folding bike every 24 hours and joins a multi-stage manual production line to make his own bicycle. Meanwhile Cherry Healey gets some tips from Cycling Team GB to help us all improve our pedal power, including how lowering your body position can make a 10 per cent improvement to speed and efficiency. And historian Ruth Goodman reveals that folding bikes date back to the 1870s, and how 70,000 folding `parabikes' were manufactured during the Second World War, some of which played a role in the D-Day landings.(n)

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and Angela Scanlon present the next stage of the contest, with robots Supernova, Frostbite, Wyrm, High 5, Crushtacean, Ironside 3, Pulsar and Apex battling it out through a series of nine face-offs. Professor Noel Sharkey, Dr Lucy Rogers and Professor Sethu Vijayakumar judge the outcomes, while Jonathan Pearce provides running commentary on the action.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86.(n)

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The first of two programmes in which the presenter explores the country that lies at the crossroads between Europe and Asia, and discovers the dramatic changes it is undergoing. The first leg of his journey begins in Istanbul, from which he travels along the Aegean coast to the hostile border with Syria. He meets refugees trying to start a new life and a billionaire taking advantage of a property boom. He moves on into the Taurus Mountains and the Black Sea Coast, and visits a community trying to keep an ancient language alive.(n)

programme.title: Cold in July
programme.desc: Premiere. A small-town man is hailed as a hero after he shoots dead a burglar who had broken into his home. He begins to fear for his life when the thief's father turns up seeking revenge, which is only the first in a series of events that plunge his simple life into chaos. Crime thriller based on Joe R Lansdale's novel, starring Michael C Hall, Sam Shepard and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan comperes an evening of stand-up at London's Hammersmith Apollo, treating the audience to his own brand of humour before introducing routines by comedy circuit stars Jason Byrne and Stewart Francis.(n)

programme.title: Night Train to Lisbon
programme.desc: An academic impulsively pursues a woman he met by chance, leading to him abandoning his job to follow her to Lisbon. On the journey, he reads a book belonging to her, and is inspired by the philosopher who wrote it. He sets out to track down everyone who knew the author to discover the story of his life. Drama based on Pascal Mercier's novel, starring Jeremy Irons and Melanie Laurent.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Bangor, north Wales, where the panel comprises Conservative Policing Minister Brandon Lewis, Shadow Defence Secretary Nia Griffith, Plaid Cymru leader Leanne Wood, Church of England priest and writer Giles Fraser, and columnist Hugo Rifkind.(n)

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Essie is shocked when Parker turns up with a friend, while Zosia is harbouring a secret from Ollie, and is horrified to learn that Isaac knows what it is. Elsewhere, Fletch is relieved when Serena steps in to help him with his daughter's adolescent woes.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Fugitives
programme.desc: Metropolitan Police officers seek a man accused of a murder in Poland, while detectives in West Yorkshire try to find a man accused of stealing and killing pigs in Hungary.(n)

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Upcycling expert Sarah Moore tasks carpenter Norman Wilkinson with reimagining an old wall cabinet, while she takes on the challenge of restyling a fashion mannequin.(n)

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The remaining two designers battle to be crowned champion in the grand final of the competition. Standing in between them and the title is the challenge of transforming three rooms in apartments in an 18th-century mock castle in Broadstairs. To make the challenge more difficult than ever, the rooms are larger than before and for the first time, each designer will be tackling a kitchen. As the race for the title nears its end, the pair must impress Daniel Hopwood and Kelly Hoppen, as well as former judge and interior stylist Sophie Robinson. Presented by Tom Dyckhoff. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live
programme.desc: A chance to stay up to date on the day's leading stories, with the latest breaking news as it happens.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from correspondents around the country. Presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Two Tribes
programme.desc: Richard Osman presents the quickfire quiz in which the seven contestants are split into teams according to what they have in common with one another, based on their responses to questions about themselves. There follows a series of general knowledge rounds in which one contestant is eliminated each time, ending with two players going head to head for a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Building Dream Homes
programme.desc: Edinburgh-based architect David Blaikie forges ahead with the modern extension that will double the size of a couple's historic home, but money is tight and the pressures of the build push the family to breaking point. In Dorset, Paul Robinson and Laurence Bowen design a state-of-the-art house, but horrific weather and complicated nature of the construction threaten to derail the whole project.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Writer and comedy actor Adil Ray joins Brian Conley to discuss the shows of his youth, and to explain how the Liverpool-set Bread inspired him to create Asian sitcom Citizen Khan.(n)

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are
programme.desc: Coronation Street star William Roache, who has played Ken Barlow since the soap began in 1960, learns about his family's entrepreneurial past. He discovers the cafe his grandmother Zillah Waddicor ran on the site of Alton Towers in the 1920s and 30s was a far more ambitious business than he had been led to believe, and learns about the challenges she faced in her personal and professional lives. He also delves into the story of his great-grandfather James, a trader who dealt in some highly unusual wares in late 19th-century Blackpool.(n)

programme.title: More Creatures Great and Small
programme.desc: Adam deals with a life-saving emergency when a dog is hit by a train, and in Teesside, Richard artificially inseminates Welsh black cattle. Meanwhile, at the rural practice Steve tries to clip a budgerigar's claws. Narrated by Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough documents the universal tale that unites humanity with every other animal on the planet - the journey through life, and the goal to continue the bloodline through offspring. This edition focuses on the first hurdle any animal will face, surviving infancy. Cameras follow flightless barnacle goose chicks as they strive to find food, leaping 400ft down a cliff from the ledge where they hatched. Meanwhile, in New Zealand, young fur seals have stumbled across a safe haven in which they can learn how to avoid predators, while deep in the Gobi Desert, the long-eared jerboa learns to use its impeccable hearing to catch insect pray. Plus, albatross chicks make their first flight, as threatening tiger sharks wait patiently for them to slip up and land in the sea.(n)

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Anita Manning and Philip Serrell embark on another trip, travelling through the Lake District and West Yorkshire before ending at their first auction in Cleveleys, Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: New series. A team of experts tries to restore family heirlooms and treasured possessions to their former glory, beginning with a clock, a carving of a flying fish and an accordion.(n)

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Chris Harris and Matt LeBlanc compete in a race across the Arabian peninsula, pitting a Bugatti Chiron against an assortment of other ways of travelling - with money no object. Rory Reid creates a life-size arcade game to put city cars to the test, and Tinie Tempah takes a ride on the Top Gear track in a Toyota GT86.(n)

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The first semi-final takes place as two teams of four students compete to make it to the final of the competition, which was won last year by Peterhouse, Cambridge. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer shares ideas to make everyday family meals special with no-fuss dishes and also tries her hand at milking a goat before showing her granddaughter how to make her own goat's cheese for a family picnic.(n)

programme.title: Amazing Hotels: Life Beyond the Lobby
programme.desc: New series. Giles Coren and Monica Galetti join the staff working in some of the most extraordinary hotels around the world, beginning with Marina Bay Sands in Singapore, which employs 9,500 people and caters for a million guests a year. Their duties include acting as attendants at the world's largest infinity pool, working as a butler under a former special forces officer, and joining a catering team that provides Brazilian, Chinese, French and Japanese cuisine for 60 restaurants.(n)

programme.title: Cradle to Grave
programme.desc: The Bakers find themselves living double lives as Fred starts work as a commissionaire - only to come into conflict with the manager - and Danny is mistaken for David Essex's brother, something he willingly exploits when he realises how much it impresses the girls. However, Bet might be living the most dangerous lie of all with her friendship with Keith from work.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis.(n)

programme.title: Imagine
programme.sub-title: Imagine: A Picture of the Painter Howard Hodgkin.
programme.desc: Alan Yentob's 2006 profile of the reclusive artist, who died earlier this month. Featuring contributions by Seamus Heaney, William Boyd, Julian Barnes and Colm Toibin.(n)

programme.title: Revolution and Romance: Musical Masters of the 19th Century
programme.desc: Suzy Klein's odyssey through the history of music in the 19th century concludes, turning the spotlight on later years, when technological revolutions seemed to make the world a smaller, more accessible place. Focusing on the Paris Exposition of 1889, a cultural showcase celebrating the centenary of the French Revoution, she reveals how composers such as Claude Debussy were exposed to the sounds of the East - immediately breaking Wagner's stranglehold of influence over Western music. She also examines the invention of saxophone, and makes her own recording on a vintage phonograph - an early precursor of vinyl records, cassette tapes and CDs. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Classic Comps
programme.desc: Compilations of performances from the BBC archives, including Ravi Shankar's Raaf Bihag and Dudley Moore playing the Colonel Bogey March. Also featuring appearances by guitarist John Williams, cellist Jacqueline du Pre, trumpeter Wynton Marsalis and violinist Nigel Kennedy on programmes including Parkinson, Later with Jools Holland, The Les Dawson Show, Music at Night and Wogan.(n)

programme.title: 6 Music 2017 Festival Highlights
programme.desc: Performances from the three-day festival held in Glasgow, featuring Belle and Sebastian, the Shins, Honeyblood, Grandaddy and Loyle Carner.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bob Monkhouse
programme.desc: The story of the comedian and game show host's life and career, told through the archive of films, TV shows, letters and memorabilia that he left behind after his death in 2003. Contributors include Ronnie Corbett, Barry Cryer, Michael Grade and Lenny Henry.(n)

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.sub-title: Timewatch: The Last Days of World War One.
programme.desc: Broadcaster Michael Palin tells the story of how the First World War ended on November 11, 1918, and reveals that soldiers continued to be killed in battle for many hours after the armistice had been signed. Recounting the events of the days and hours leading up to the 11 o'clock ceasefire, Palin tells the personal stories of some of the last troops to die.(n)

programme.title: Tank Men
programme.desc: Marking the 100th anniversary of the first time tanks were used in battle, Rob Bell tells the story of the First World War tank men and the impact they had on the conflict.(n)

programme.title: The Century That Wrote Itself
programme.desc: Adam Nicolson examines how the writing revolution of the 17th century helped redefine society's vision of the world, as individuals began to question attitudes toward God, the nature of reality and the structure of the universe. The advancement of literacy allowed creative thought and significant scientific advances not only to be recorded, but shared.(n)

programme.title: How to Get Ahead
programme.sub-title: How to Get Ahead: At Renaissance Court.
programme.desc: The three-part documentary continues as writer and broadcaster Stephen Smith explores Renaissance Florence under the reign of Grand Duke Cosimo Medici, whose fledgling court prized the finer things in life. Successful courtiers had to have brains as well as brawn, and some looked to theorists like Niccolo Machiavelli for underhand ways to get ahead, while enlightened polymaths turned their minds to the heavens - and to ice-cream.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great Irish Journeys with Martha Kearney
programme.desc: The broadcaster continues to trace the footsteps of 19th-century artist and geologist George Victor Du Noyer, who spent 35 years charting the landscape, people and buildings of Ireland. Martha travels north, taking in the extraordinary beauty of Dunluce Castle, and onwards to Mussenden Temple, pondering its unusual location. She also marvels at how Belfast was shaped by the Victorians, visits Kearney Point on the Ards Peninsula and journeys south to Dunmoe, which overlooks the site of the Battle of the Boyne.(n)

programme.title: Racing Legends
programme.desc: Paul Hollywood explores the life and times of the motorsport great, who died earlier this month. To gain an insight into one of Britain's greatest sportsmen, Paul takes to the track and the Isle of Man circuit to recreate some of John's finest moments, while the man himself looks back on a life filled with danger, glamour and intrigue. With contributions from Surtees' wife and daughters as well as rivals and commentators.(n)

programme.title: Crash and Burn
programme.desc: Documentary charting the story of professional motor racing driver Tommy Byrne, who during the 1980s went from stock-car racing to big-time Formula One in a little over four years. But while his rise was meteoric, his fall was just as spectacular.(n)

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary about the effects that long-term solitary confinement have on prisoners, following recently released prisoners when they go from isolation to the streets. The film examines the psychological impact of solitary, the baggage offenders carry with them back into the community and whether this type of imprisonment makes the general public more or less safe.(n)

programme.title: Oceans
programme.desc: In the second of two episodes examining the Indian Ocean, Paul Rose, Philippe Cousteau Jr, Dr Lucy Blue and Tooni Mahto explore the impact the ocean's tides and currents have on coastal areas. They join a group of scientists working on an experiment to predict extreme weather, and dive down to a coral colony - an environment in which they can learn about changes in the planet's climate.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team's mission to track the arsonist targeting US Navy facilities appears to end in success when the man in question is killed by a thermite explosion on board the USS Brewer. Meanwhile, Abby studies evidence relating to fire-starter Bruce Johnson, who died when his car exploded, and discovers coded messages in his quarters that indicate he may have been working as part of a larger gang. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The investigators discover probationary agent Ned Dorneget has been bugged by Harper Dearing, the man behind a spate of arson attacks on US Navy vessels. A phone call from the man himself makes it clear he is out for revenge, and Sam Ryan has information as to the motive behind it. Guest starring Richard Schiff (The West Wing).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team tries to track down wanted terrorist Harper Dearing before another US Navy ship is destroyed, and a desperate Gibbs enlists the aid of a prisoner to draw his target out of hiding. programme.desc: Agents G Callen and Sam Hanna investigate after a naval officer is killed during an LAPD shootout, with two other men who died in the gun battle being identified as members of a Mexican drug cartel. programme.sub-title: The Killing of a One-Eyed Bookie.

Drama, starring Ross Kemp, Jamie Draven and Tony Curran.(n)

programme.desc: Episode 620. programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps a father to create a fun bedroom for his two daughters. She creates a pinboard using a bold vintage fabric, and a garland from the felt offcuts. Plus, the girls help to personalise some jewellery boxes.(n)

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie clashes with the staff at an Italian restaurant and forbids Doug from ever going back there - but he just cannot resist their food. Meanwhile, Arthur prepares for an appearance on TV. Comedy, starring Kevin James.(n)

programme.title: Cycling
programme.desc: Action from the seven-day race, which took riders through New Zealand's Southern Alps, featuring more than 500km of tough trails and 15,000m of climbing.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra throws a bridal shower for Amy, but Marie tries to take over and monopolises the event. Comedy, starring Ray Romano, Patricia Heaton and Monica Horan.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Robert asks if he can borrow the suitcase sitting on the stairway landing, Ray explains he and Debra have been locked in a two-week battle of wills over who is responsible for putting the item away. Ray Romano and Brad Garrett star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes a sudden liking to fast food, Ronee alarms Martin by revealing her mother is coming to town, while Frasier pines for attractive matchmaker Charlotte, and heads for a singles bar to drown his sorrows. Comedy, guest starring Laura Linney and Jennifer Tilly, with Kelsey Grammer.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Frank almost gets in the way of Frasier's latest meeting with Charlotte, but the pair finally admit their feelings. Roz goes on a date with a jailbird and Martin plans to present Ronee with an old engagement ring - until Daphne points out how insensitive it would be.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by guests Adam Woodyatt, Jamie Laing, Katherine Ryan and Lisa Faulkner. With music from Zara Larsson.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: A snowstorm leaves Bart, Lisa and their fellow students trapped inside Springfield Elementary and it is not long before the pupils are running amok. Homer and Ned Flanders are left to mount the rescue operation to save the kids - and Principal Skinner.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Doctors discover Homer has had a crayon lodged in his brain since childhood and decide to remove it. The procedure instantly transforms him into a genius, but removes his ability to enjoy life.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Marge helps a former convict fulfil his artistic ambitions by painting a mural at the school, but he soon clashes with Principal Skinner over the design. With the guest voice of Michael Keaton.(n)

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the opening round of the season at Albert Park in Melbourne, where Mercedes will have been looking to steer one of their drivers to victory for the fourth year in succession. Last year's world champion Nico Rosberg, who took the chequered flag here in 2014 and 2016, was not part of the team following his decision to retire at the end of last season, with Valtteri Bottas now partnering Lewis Hamilton.(n)

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: George Clarke meets Colin and Emma Clewes, who have bought an Edwardian Baptist church in the small Pennine village of Oxenhope, with the idea of turning it into a five-bedroom family home. With only a meagre budget, Colin intends to do most of the building work himself, while the couple juggle looking after their young family and running their own business. But as they soon find out, restoring a church that has been in decline for years demands every ounce of their hard graft and grit. George offers advice and inspiration to pull them through, and discovers that the church's history is woven into the fabric of this small mill-working community.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer meets expectant parents Steve and Sally, who are relocating to the countryside around Stratford-upon-Avon in Warwickshire. They want to find their dream family home before the baby arrives, but with nearby rural walks, office space and a good village pub on the wish list, Phil has to act fast. Kirstie Allsopp is in Northamptonshire helping Rinku and Sunder. They have been living in a family owned property for the past three years, enabling them to save to buy a place together. However, there are new plans for the land and the bulldozers are inbound, so it's Kirstie's challenge to get the couple into their own home quickly.(n)

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Our Guy in China
programme.desc: Guy Martin explores Beijing, ignoring the tourist traps and following his own passions as he reveals a lesser-seen side of China. He meets families who live on a scrapyard and earn their livings by processing old cars and spends an afternoon helping out by operating the cranes and machinery, before visiting the hub of the market for rare and exotic supercar sales and assists in the building of what will be the tallest building in Beijing, the China Zun skyscraper.(n)

programme.title: Rivers with Jeremy Paxman
programme.desc: The presenter travels along the Thames from its source in Gloucestershire to the Kent and Essex marshes, and delves into its history as a working river going back to the time of the Domesday Book. He meets people who maintain the river's locks and bridges, and work to manage flooding and deal with sewage. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homeland
programme.desc: Carrie catches a break, Keane makes a plan and Max goes undercover. Drama, starring Claire Danes, Rupert Friend and Elizabeth Marvel.(n)

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The eagle-eyed armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week. The programme captures their instant reactions and lively discussions from the comfort of their own homes.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Grease 2
programme.desc: A shy English boy joins the senior class at Rydell High and immediately falls for the leader of the Pink Ladies. But she is only interested in tough guys, forcing him to adopt a dual identity as a mysterious biker. Musical sequel, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Maxwell Caulfield, Lorna Luft, Eve Arden and Sid Caesar, with Didi Conn reprising her role as Frenchy from the original film.(n)

programme.title: UK's Best Place to Live
programme.desc: Sarah Beeny reveals the United Kingdom's most desirable place to live. With the help of analysis of key factors, she travels around the UK looking for good affordable housing, best job prospects, reasonable child care, quality of family life and of social life. At the end of the show she reveals which location scores best.(n)

programme.title: Great British Buildings: Restoration of the Year
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud and Anna Keay visit some of the UK's most successful restorations of historic buildings, all of which have been placed on the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors' long list for their Restoration of the Year award. First up are a watermill brought back to life in Cambridgeshire, a seaside villa in Lyme Regis, a Georgian innovation in Northumberland, and a rescued castle in Ceredigion. At the end of the programme, Kevin and Anna hear which buildings have been chosen to make the final shortlist.(n)

programme.title: Building the Dream

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and her team help Shaun and Jannine Cartwright and their three sons transform their Blackburn home, which is full of clutter. They look to the 1950s for inspiration, creating a family playroom for the boys.(n)

programme.title: Fifteen to One

programme.desc: Doug learns Carrie is turned on by an Italian accent he has mastered, but worries that she is falling out of love with his real self, while Arthur finds inspiration between the covers of a book. Kevin James and Leah Remini star.(n)

In the north of the island, Richard and Lena visit a guachinche pop-up restaurant, where they have goat stew before exploring the barren lunar-like landscape around the volcanic Mount Teide and spend the evening stargazing. There is also a sculpture tour, including works by Henry Moore and Joan Miro, as well as layered coffee, a spot of golf and a search for whales.(n)

But their family is set to expand again, with baby number 17 on the way - and Enoch is also courting a third wife, 25-year-old nanny Lydia.(n)

Rob Reiner's comic fantasy adventure, with Cary Elwes, Robin Wright, Chris Sarandon, Mandy Patinkin, Peter Falk and Fred Savage.(n)

programme.desc: Youngster Dorothy Gale is whisked over the rainbow by a tornado into the magical land of Oz, where she inadvertently kills a wicked witch - incurring the wrath of another. Musical fantasy, with Judy Garland, Ray Bolger, Jack Haley, Bert Lahr and Frank Morgan.(n)

programme.desc: Identical twin sisters who are unaware of each other's existence meet by accident. They decide to join forces in a bid to reunite their estranged parents, and switch places to get the warring couple to kiss and make up. Remake of the 1961 Disney comedy, starring Dennis Quaid, Natasha Richardson, Elaine Hendrix and Lindsay Lohan in a dual role.(n)

programme.desc: A dance instructor at a 1960s resort hotel fears his career will be jeopardised when his regular partner is forced to pull out of an important show in which they are due to perform. Luckily, a naive teenager is happy to step in, and is treated to a whirlwind holiday education in life, love and expressing herself. Romantic drama, starring Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Grey and Jerry Orbach. Includes 5 News Update at 6pm.(n)

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world.(n)

programme.title: Michael Jackson's This Is It
programme.desc: Documentary following rehearsals for the singer's planned 50-night series of concerts at London's O2, immediately before his untimely death in 2009. Featuring interviews with Jackson, performances of classic hits including Billy Jean and Wanna Be Startin' Something, and an insight into the elaborate preparations for the shows that were never staged.(n)

programme.title: Michael Jackson: Man in the Mirror
programme.desc: Profile of the singer, following his development from child star with the Jackson 5 to becoming an iconic performer in his own right as an adult. The programme explores his difficult relationship with his family and makes the case that growing up in the public eye had a devastating psychological impact that he was never able to recover from.(n)

programme.title: Rich and Acquitted
programme.desc: The singer's 2005 trial on charges of child molestation, which concluded with him being found not guilty on all charges. Featuring in-depth interviews from Jackson's attorneys and the prosecution, who discuss the circumstances of the case and the factors that led to the prosecution case collapsing.(n)

programme.title: Kings of Pop
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes narrates a celebration of pop music's greatest ever male solo artists. programme.title: SuperCasino

programme.desc: The return of the documentary following the work of officers from police forces across Yorkshire, from the urban environment of the big cities to the Dales. A high-speed night-time pursuit in Bradford heightens tensions in the local community, with outnumbered cops facing the prospect of a potential riot. An apparently routine stop takes a serious turn as the vehicle pulled over is thought to contain a firearm and the unarmed officers must hold their nerve as they wait for a specialist team to join them. Naval crime drama, guest starring Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.desc: Christmas Eve marks the start of an ambitious programme of engineering as the workers of Network Rail embark upon 200 maintenance jobs around the country. The cameras follow teams in Leeds and Newcastle as they take on the elements to lay new track and replace dated infrastructure.(n)

programme.title: All New Traffic Cops
programme.sub-title: All New Traffic Cops: Under Attack.
programme.desc: A high-speed chase in Bradford is ended when CS gas is used to bring a determined speeder to justice, while teams are out on quiet back roads as they track two cars that are thought to be connected with various firearms offences. Plus, burglars find out they cannot outrun the cops when weighed down with a quad bike and trailing a cloud of cannabis behind them.(n)

programme.title: Fury
programme.desc: A veteran American sergeant leads a tank crew on one final dangerous mission in the last months of the Second World War. The assignment takes the soldiers behind enemy lines and into battle with overwhelming enemy forces, while the presence of an inexperienced new recruit in the team raises tension. Drama, starring Brad Pitt and Shia LaBeouf.(n)

programme.title: Play Misty for Me

When these fail, her desire is transformed into an uncontrolled bid for revenge. Clint Eastwood's directorial debut. Clint Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider

In the late 1800s, a young girl witnesses a violent attack on a gold-mining settlement and prays for a miracle to save the camp and its people. Her prayers seem answered when a stranger arrives and helps the prospectors defend themselves. But his real motives are a mystery(n)

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: A well-to-do businesswoman marries a charming man after a whirlwind romance, but six years later he dies in an accident, leaving troubling evidence that he was not who he claimed to be(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In November 1974, a family of six was brutally murdered. Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.desc: Tense thriller. Car thief Memphis Raines is forced to steal 50 luxury vehicles in one night in order to save the life of his brother, who has fallen foul of a dangerous crime lord. Once the most successful car thief in California, Raines must reassemble his old gang to fulfil the almost impossible mission. His task is further hampered by a rival band of thieves and the local police(n)

programme.desc: Giant carnivorous worms threaten a desert community in this good-natured spoof of a B-grade 1950s horror movie(n)

What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

Writer-director Guillermo del Toro's sequel improves on his original, showcasing wickedly elegant monsters and spectacular action sequences(n)

programme.title: Run Fatboy Run
programme.desc: It's not easy to win back a woman after leaving her at the altar, but when an out-of-shape man finally realises just what a mistake he's made, he vows to run a high-profile marathon in order to convince his ex-fiancée that the rich and handsome man she's about to marry isn't the guy for her(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: On Thursday nights three female friends -- Alex, Sukie, and Jane -- meet to chug martinis, learn Chinese aphrodisiac cooking and lament the scarcity of eligible men. As they sit around, they fantasize about and describe their idea of the ideal male. Arriving in town the following day is Satan, disguised as mysterious stranger Darrell Van Horn. One by one, Van Horne seduces each of the women. Then, strange things begin to happen(n)

programme.title: Bad Santa
programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton is hilarious in this deliciously warped holiday comedy from director Terry Zwigoff ("Ghost World"). Thornton plays a vulgar, boozy con artist who robs the department stores where he works as St. Nick(n)

programme.title: Emelie
programme.desc: When their regular babysitter can't make it, two suburban parents hire her friend "Anna" (Sarah Bolger) to look after their three children while they enjoy a night out. But when Anna's behavior becomes increasingly unhinged, eldest sibling Jacob (Joshua Rush) grows suspicious and discovers that she's actually an imposter named Emelie who has sinister designs on the family's youngest child. Directed by Michael Thelin, Emelie made its world premiere at the 2015 Tribeca Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Dark Water
programme.desc: Dahlia and daughter Ceci are happy in their New York apartment until stagnant water begins to seep through the roof. Is someone - or something - living upstairs? Psychological horror from the author of The Ring(n)

programme.title: The X-Files: I Want to Believe
programme.desc: David Duchovny and Gillian Anderson reprise their roles as Fox Mulder and Dana Scully with this long-delayed big-screen continuation that revives the series six years after it headed off the air in 2002. Creator Chris Carter returns to direct, co-writing the script with series veteran Frank Spotnitz for 20th Century Fox. Billy Connolly, Amanda Peet and rapper Xzibit co-star in the stand-alone sequel(n)

programme.title: Everest
programme.desc: In this adventure docudrama set in 1996, several groups of climbers successfully scale Mount Everest, only to be faced with tragedy when a monster snowstorm surprises them as they attempt to make their descent(n)

programme.title: Changing Lanes
programme.desc: A highway shunt between lawyer Gavin Banek and divorcee Doyle Gipson turns nasty. Banek, late for court, flees the scene. Gipson arrives late too - and finds out he's lost access to his kids. To his mind, it's Banek's fault and he's going to pay. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Trapped
programme.desc: In this tense thriller, a young girl with asthma is kidnapped and held for ransom, but her captors tell her parents that they'll deprive the child of her medication unless they comply with their terms, one of which is not to contact the police(n)

programme.title: The Bourne Ultimatum
programme.desc: The explosive third installment of the popular franchise featuring Matt Damon as Jason Bourne, a CIA-trained assassin suffering from amnesia. In this dynamic thrill ride, he's on a quest to discover his true identity and how he became a consummate killer(n)

programme.title: Marauders
programme.desc: FBI agents investigating a series of bank robberies initially suspect that the business's owner might be responsible, but they later realise that the heists point toward a much-larger conspiracy(n)

programme.title: Michael Clayton
programme.desc: Michael Clayton handles all of the dirty work for a major New York law firm, arranging top-flight legal services and skirting through loopholes for ethically questionable clients. But when a fellow fixer decides to turn on the very firm they were hired to clean up for, Clayton finds himself at the centre of a conspiratorial maelstrom(n)

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection
programme.desc: Hit man Arthur Bishop is forced to come out of retirement and commit three difficult assassinations in order to rescue his kidnapped lover. The hardest part: He must make all of the killings look like accidents(n)

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: An atmospheric phenomenon enables a New York firefighter to communicate with his son 30 years in the future. His son warns him of his death in a warehouse blaze. But changing history triggers a new series of tragic events(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: When terrorists seize control of an airliner, an intelligence analyst accompanies a commando unit for a midair boarding operation(n)

programme.title: Enter the Dragon
programme.desc: Bruce Lee uses a martial arts tournament as the pretext to infiltrate the island fortress of a one-armed drug baron. Forget the story, watch the moves(n)

programme.title: Lights Out
programme.desc: This utterly chilling horror film centers on a young woman who must protect her brother from a terrifying apparition that only manifests in total darkness. Later, she realizes that this fearsome entity is connected to her mentally ill mother, who has started hallucinating conversations with a mysterious figure named Diana(n)

programme.title: Play Misty for Me
programme.desc: Tense thriller about a radio DJ who becomes the object of a listener's desire that escalates into a fanatical obsession. After a one-night stand, he finds himself pursued by a woman who won't take no for an answer and goes to increasingly drastic lengths to declare her undying love for him. When these fail, her desire is transformed into an uncontrolled bid for revenge. Clint Eastwood's directorial debut. Clint Eastwood(n)

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: Atmospheric western about a gun-toting preacher who defends a settlement from attack. In the late 1800s, a young girl witnesses a violent attack on a gold-mining settlement and prays for a miracle to save the camp and its people. Her prayers seem answered when a stranger arrives and helps the prospectors defend themselves. But his real motives are a mystery(n)

programme.title: I Love You, Man
programme.desc: Rip-roaringly funny buddy comedy about a hapless chap who doesn't have any male friends to serve as best man at his wedding, until he meets a freewheeling fun-loving guy who just might fill the bill, but their chummy, male-bonding bro-mance just might impact the groom's relationship with his bride-to-be(n)

programme.title: Deceived
programme.desc: A well-to-do businesswoman marries a charming man after a whirlwind romance, but six years later he dies in an accident, leaving troubling evidence that he was not who he claimed to be(n)

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: In November 1974, a family of six was brutally murdered. Now, a year later, an unsuspecting young couple, George and Kathy Lutz, and their children move into the house that was the site of the horrific event and is now haunted by a murderous presence. What follows is 28 days of unimaginable terror. With demonic visions of the dead and relentless screams of terror, this is the haunted house story that isn't just a movie - it's real(n)

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: A cop tangles with demons and angels when she probes her twin's death with a man who has literally been to hell and back. Supernatural thriller based on the "Hellblazer" graphic novels(n)

programme.desc: Tense thriller. Car thief Memphis Raines is forced to steal 50 luxury vehicles in one night in order to save the life of his brother, who has fallen foul of a dangerous crime lord. programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team tracks vicious criminal Chopper Hadley, who is back in the country for a week, with Brian going undercover to apprehend the villain. Patrick Malahide (The Inspector Alleyn Mysteries) guest stars, with Dennis Waterman, James Bolam and Alun Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Stevie helps Stuart uncover a burglary scam operating from a Santa's grotto run by an ex-con, and a few heads are turned when Father Christmas is brought in for questioning. The trail of evidence leads the team via a loan shark and fake passport dealer to a crime kingpin who is planning to skip the country. He is a man Stevie knows from when she worked undercover, and is convinced he is up to something big.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part One.
programme.desc: First of a three-part story. Stuart encourages Stevie to again work undercover as heroin dealer Rob Towler's girlfriend, not realising the chemistry that still exists between them. The case progresses well, especially when Stevie's ex-boss Jim Rutherford turns up to help. Eventually her cover is blown by a member of the gang as the Sun Hill detectives close in for a sting operation, and Stuart is left questioning his colleague's loyalties when she whisks Towler away on her motorbike and disappears without trace. Continues on Monday.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of three. The evidence against undercover cop Stevie mounts up, suggesting she has thrown away her career for the love of a villain. Stuart finally catches up with the pair, and his suspicions are confirmed when she turns a gun on her colleague and makes her escape. With the violent Tameside Crew wreaking carnage across Sun Hill in pursuit of Towler, Stuart is suspended from duty for being too close to the case. Concludes tomorrow.(n)

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: Too Hot to Handle - Part Three.
programme.desc: Part three of three. In a flashback sequence, Stevie reveals to Stuart how she discovered the drug deal was a set-up and why she disobeyed instructions in order to protect her boyfriend. Stuart is astonished that her erratic behaviour was designed to save his life and expose the real villain behind the Tameside Crew. As she makes plans to flee the country, the gang seems always to be two steps ahead of her - and Stevie still has to make the biggest decision of her life.(n)

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Ray Winstone and Douglas Booth star in this three-part dramatisation of the classic Dickens novel about an orphan's rise through high society with the assistance of a mysterious benefactor. Eleven-year-old Pip's life is changed dramatically by an encounter with escaped convict Abel Magwitch. With David Suchet, Gillian Anderson, Mark Addy and Claire Rushbrook.(n)

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Herbert Pocket takes Pip under his wing and tries to turn him into a gentleman, but the youngster's expensive taste sees him racking up debts, and his spending spirals farther out of control when he meets the charming and confident baronet Bentley Drummle. Miss Havisham asks Pip to visit her at Satis House, keen to see his transformation first-hand. With Douglas Booth, Harry Lloyd and Gillian Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Pip is devastated to learn the truth from Magwitch and rushes to Satis House, where he hears shocking news about Estella and discovers Miss Havisham has been encouraging his love for her adopted daughter out of cruelty. Wemmick warns him that rumours of Magwitch's return from Australia are rife, so he decides to help the convict evade recapture. Starring Douglas Booth, Ray Winstone, Vanessa Kirby and Gillian Anderson.(n)

Harry is disturbed to be called to a crime scene at the home of a family he knows, and finds the bodies of the mother and her teenage daughter, while her stepson lies in a coma - although her toddler has been left unharmed. The police suspect the woman's husband to be the killer, but the pathologist is not so sure of his guilt.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: An apparently routine exercise takes a terrifying turn when the power fails, communication channels go dead and Harry shows signs of illness. As desperate members of the public start trying to break into Thames House, the MI5 operatives are forced to face the horrible possibility that a crude nuclear device has actually been detonated in London. Annabelle Apsion and Jo Joyner guest star.(n)

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: The American president makes an unscheduled trip to Britain, forcing MI5 to work with the CIA to ensure his safety throughout the visit. Tom and Christine are thrown together, and it soon appears there's more to their relationship than just work - but with each new threat turning the operation into a power struggle between the rival organisations, they need to keep their minds firmly on the job.(n)

programme.title: The Mrs Bradley Mysteries

programme.sub-title: A Faraway Country About Which We Know Nothing.
programme.desc: Drama and intrigue with the aristocrats and serving staff of 165 Eaton Place as it opens its doors once more. September 1938, and as dark clouds gather over Europe, Hallam's preoccupation with Nazi Germany leads him into dangerous waters overseas. Back home, Lady Agnes is frail following the birth of her second child, and finds great support in the forthright Aunt Blanche, who has made herself comfortable at Eaton Place following the funeral of her sister Lady Holland. In the servants' quarters, Rose is taken ill with TB, so the staff welcome spirited new maid Beryl, who catches Harry's eye, while events upstairs end in a startling revelation about Mr Pritchard. programme.desc: Leonard is upset when a magazine fails to mention him in an article about the paper he co-wrote with Sheldon. Meanwhile, a blackout at Mrs Wolowitz's home leads to a final family dinner in her honour. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon can't get a toy drone to fly. A cancelled flight almost stops Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school, while Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: There is a clash of personalities when Sheldon and Leonard's mothers finally meet, while Howard finally decides to do his fair share of the housework - but not without a little help from his friends. Guest starring Christine Baranski and Laurie Metcalf.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Bernadette shares some news, the groups' reactions are not what she expected, with Wolowitz freaking out about her announcement. Comedy, Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon discovers a surprise screening of The Avengers is scheduled at a local cinema, complete with a Q&A session with the film's director, Joss Whedon. However, the event just happens to clash with time he'd planned to spend with Amy, so he decides to pay Stuart to be his subtitute for the afternoon while he and the other boys immerse themselves in Marvel superheroics. Meanwhile, Leonard's mother Beverly arrives in town for an extended visit, and Penny takes the opportunity to bond with her new mother-in-law - and to make up for not inviting her to the wedding. Comedy, guest starring Christine Baranski.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy's attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. however, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret.(n)

programme.title: Iron Man 2
programme.desc: Tycoon-turned-superhero Tony Stark confronts a fearsome new foe in a Russian scientist using his own deadly hi-tech weapons to seek revenge. He also faces a struggle to keep his secrets out of the hands of both the government and an amoral rival, and discovers the armour he developed to fight evil is slowly killing him. Action adventure sequel, with Robert Downey Jr, Mickey Rourke and Don Cheadle. Edited for language and violence.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD
programme.desc: Coulson grows closer to May, unaware of the dark secret she is hiding. Aida continues her relentless search for the Darkhold.(n)

programme.title: The Adjustment Bureau
programme.desc: A politician is attracted to a dancer he meets at a pivotal moment in his life, but finds his every effort to get to know her is thwarted by a group of mysterious men. He realises these shadowy figures are manipulating him and moving him toward a predetermined fate, which he resolves to fight. Sci-fi thriller, starring Matt Damon and Emily Blunt.(n)

programme.title: Tattoo Fixers
programme.desc: Trendsetter James needs some landscaping done over his stickman, Nicole wants a girly makeover for her tatt, and Joanne requires an inking to stop her getting spanked.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: When Adam tries to develop an acting career, a talent agent decides he is only suitable for nerd roles, so Beverly makes it her mission to turn him into a teen heartthrob.(n)

programme.title: Marvel's Agents of SHIELD
programme.desc: Coulson grows closer to May, unaware of the dark secret she is hiding. Aida continues her relentless search for the Darkhold.(n)

programme.title: Gap Year
programme.desc: The gang goes on a trek and get lost in the Malaysian jungle, where Lauren discovers the truth about Dylan and Ashley, while Sean receives unexpected romantic attention.(n)

programme.title: Melissa & Joey
programme.desc: Mel's father returns to the town to lobby for a bill that his daughter is strongly opposed to. Elsewhere, some of Lennox's poems catch the attention of a popular classmate who wants to become a singer. Starring Melissa Joan Hart and Joey Lawrence.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Omnibus. Ellie drags Freddie away from Nightingales, but is stuck in a nightmare situation when she gets home.(n)

programme.title: Suburgatory
programme.sub-title: No, You Can't Sit with Us.
programme.desc: Tessa decides to take a young social outcast under her wing and help her to compete in the Little Miss Chatswin pageant. However, the rivalry between her and Dalia's protege begins to heat up, and Tessa finds herself stooping to Dalia's level in her attempts to win. Meanwhile, Fred accidentally loses his son in the wilderness when he, George, Noah and Victor go on a weekend camping trip. Comedy, starring Jeremy Sisto and Jane Levy.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: A Wrong Day's Journey into Right.
programme.desc: An overworked Paige decides to conjure up Mr Right once again in a bid to relieve her stress, but accidentally unleashes his evil twin Mr Wrong - who tries to trick her into killing her sisters. Supernatural drama, starring Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano and Rose McGowan.(n)

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The tourists arrive in Marseille, where a pole-dancing class gets pulses racing, while one couple are beginning to feel isolated and hit out at the vote.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Drama following the lives and loves of a group of teenagers and young adults in Chester.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the comedy about the changing relationships between a married couple, newly engaged sweethearts, and a bachelor as they struggle to cope with the highs and lows of love. Jeff tries to give Adam advice after he proposes to Jennifer, and Russell is set up on a date. David Spade stars.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: Plans are made for Jeff's birthday party celebrations, although Audrey becomes a little too involved. Adam discusses a special present with Jennifer, but she wishes to have one too - leaving Russell puzzled about the nature of the mystery gift.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Mike is impressed when Mandy starts an internet campaign to save a barbershop, while Vanessa struggles to balance her many tasks.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Vanessa worries about Mike's growing desire to travel for work, while doubts arise when Mandy announces her plans to become a vegan.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Piper and Phoebe come to the rescue of a witch whose necklace has been stolen - without realising they are being hunted down as part of a demonic reality TV show. They must also try to vanquish the person who will turn Wyatt evil before Chris is due to be born. Starring Holly Marie Combs, Rose McGowan and Alyssa Milano.(n)

programme.title: Charmed
programme.sub-title: It's a Bad, Bad, Bad, Bad World - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gideon teleports Leo and Chris to an evil dimension, where everything is a mirror image of the normal world. Phoebe and Paige are sent to find them, facing a race against time as Piper prepares to give birth. Holly Marie Combs, Alyssa Milano, Brian Krause and Drew Fuller star.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Barney comes to the conclusion that Ted thinks too much and decides there is only one cure - getting him hopelessly drunk. The next day, the gang helps him piece together the hazy incidents of the previous night.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted searches for the best New Year's Eve party in New York, and hires a limo so he and his friends can travel to five different celebrations on the same night. However, Robin plans to spend the evening with her new boyfriend, Derek - so Ted's co-worker Marybeth takes her place in the group.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam breaks his arm and tells his school friends he fell off a hoverboard like the hero in Back to the Future, but the lie threatens his friendship with Emmy Mirsky. Meanwhile, Beverly fears she's being replaced in the kitchen when the family falls in love with the new Chinese restaurant in town. An 11-year old boy captures his family on his video camera as they grow up in the 1980s. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: The Most Handsome Boy on the Planet.
programme.desc: Barry is excited when a modelling agency representative approaches him, but Erica thinks it's a scam. Meanwhile, Adam tries to get Murray to build bridges with his father.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Sheldon and Howard face problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Plus, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Raj dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop, while Raj sells out Leonard and Howard after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Ted discovers Robin is going on a camping trip with her smarmy colleague Sandy Rivers, and decides to make a last-ditch attempt to win her love - with some help from one of Barney's ex-girlfriends. Meanwhile, Marshall is distraught when he discovers Lily has applied for a fellowship in San Francisco.(n)

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother
programme.desc: Marshall's friends try to help him get over his break-up with Lily - but just when it seems like he might be cheering up, he discovers she may be back in town. Meanwhile, Ted is feeling positive about his new relationship with Robin, but she has yet to tell him about her love of guns. Featuring an appearance by funk musician George Clinton.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Mike and Ed have doubts about Kyle's sporting ability, while Vanessa has some explaining to do to Eva and Mandy.(n)

programme.title: Last Man Standing
programme.desc: Mike's dad Bud moves to town, but Vanessa is worried that his well-intentioned ways will backfire. Robert Forster guest stars, with Tim Allen and Nancy Travis.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam has a birthday sleepover, during which his friend Garry shares out some of his father's home-brewed beer and makes everyone sick. Meanwhile, Barry and Erica want a new CD player, but Murray tells them he will only buy one for them if they write the greatest song ever.(n)

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly discovers Adam is failing in Spanish class, and immediately blames his teacher. However, when she arranges for him to receive extra tuition, her plan backfires.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is fired for being disrespectful to his boss, and explores new activities in a bid to find a purpose in life other than physics, but Leonard takes drastic action to restore him to his old self. Laurie Metcalf guest stars as Sheldon's mother.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard fears he is wasting his time with Penny and ends up spending the night with fellow scientist Leslie. However, he is disappointed when she later tells him she was only interested in a one-night stand. Meanwhile, Sheldon frets over a change to his hamburger routine. Starring Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco and Jim Parsons.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Mercedes and Scott are up to no good when they steal the keys for James's flat and find something they can use to their advantage, James' embarrassing audition DVDs from his Law School Drama Society. Elsewhere, alone with Ste, Lucas and Leah, Amy still feels torn about the thought of moving.(n)

programme.title: Baby Daddy
programme.desc: New series. Ben is still enthusiastically searching for the mysterious Elle, while Danny and Riley are hunting for a doctor to help with the pregnancy. Return of the comedy.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard returns from his space mission, but the welcome from his friends and family does not meet his expectations. His night alone with Bernadette goes badly, his mother ignores him, and he realises Stuart has taken his place as Raj's best friend. On top of that, Sheldon, Amy, Leonard and Penny kick him out of their group games night. Comedy, starring Simon Helberg.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends try to solve the mystery of Sheldon's post-lunch activities, following him to a secret room where they discover how he chills out. Elsewhere, Leonard is jealous when Penny starts texting a classmate, but things quickly change when Alex gets flirty with him.(n)

programme.title: Made in Chelsea
programme.desc: Tiff starts to wonder if she and Sam want different things out of their relationship, while Julius finds himself on the receiving end of the affections of Daisy Robbins.(n)

programme.title: Empire
programme.desc: The American drama returns after a mid-series break. Lucious announces his new music project, while Jamal befriends a musician during his stay in rehab. Guest starring Rumer Willis.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is furious when the university forces him to work with Kripke, while Howard's hobby lands him in financial trouble. However, that doesn't stop him and Raj getting expensive action figures of themselves made - much to Bernadette's disapproval.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An argument between Leonard and Sheldon over the ending of a Harry Potter book affects Amy and Penny's living arrangements. Meanwhile, Howard goes on a trip to Las Vegas with Bernadette and asks Raj to keep an eye on his mother while he is away.(n)
