programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough documents the universal tale that unites humanity with every other animal on the planet - the journey through life, and the goal to continue the bloodline through offspring. This edition focuses on the first hurdle any animal will face, surviving infancy. Cameras follow flightless barnacle goose chicks as they strive to find food, leaping 400ft down a cliff from the ledge where they hatched. Meanwhile, in New Zealand, young fur seals have stumbled across a safe haven in which they can learn how to avoid predators, while deep in the Gobi Desert, the long-eared jerboa learns to use its impeccable hearing to catch insect pray. Plus, albatross chicks make their first flight, as threatening tiger sharks wait patiently for them to slip up and land in the sea.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough details the transition animals go through as they grow into adults. Looking at examples including a tiger cub whose family is under threat, a vulnerable veined octopus and a pair of sibling cheetahs guarding against starvation, the veteran naturalist illustrates how they develop new skills and learn how to survive on their own.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of homes to animals, not only as a place to live but as a shelter from the elements and a refuge from enemies. A pack of African hunting dogs have made their home on a vast plain in Zambia, but it's far from safe as they must battle hyenas and protect their young. Hermit crabs on a tropical island settle down in empty snail shells - and when a new property washes ashore, they all form a queue, then move up the housing chain until all the shells are taken. On the edge of the Sahara are chimpanzees, whose survival relies on knowing where to find water in the most extreme droughts. Here the elders lead a troop on a brutal trek to a dried-out riverbed to dig wells.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: The importance of power in the animal kingdom, revealing how dominant creatures have the best access to food and water, and are also the most attractive to the opposite sex. An orphaned young chimp tries to climb the social ladder, but his troop is ruled by big, aggressive males and his first attempt to join them ends in a beating. A meerkat society will only allow newcomers in if they know how to deal with a venomous snake. And the only way to occupy the top spot in a meadow of kangaroos is to beat the ruling male in a boxing match - but few have challenged the current incumbent, who stands at 8ft. Will any animal dare take him on? David Attenborough narrates.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough reveals how the competition to breed creates scenes of the most extraordinary beauty, as well as some of the most violent battles seen in nature. A male flame bowerbird shows off its artistic prowess to impress a potential mate - but if that does not prove enough, it will demonstrate its dancing skills instead. Waved albatrosses pair up for life and spend hours in each other's company, although things are not so simple for a male peacock jumping spider - one wrong move in its dazzling courtship routine could prove fatal. However, one of the most magnificent displays of all is created by a tiny male pufferfish, which impresses the ladies by building a spectacular underwater `crop circle' in the sand - arguably the most perfect and complex structure created by any animal.(n)

programme.title: Life Story
programme.desc: David Attenborough's documentary charting the circle of life in the animal kingdom ends with creatures' attempts to rear their offspring, revealing the commitment involved and how for some parents it means risking their own lives. A turtle hauls itself up the beach to lay its eggs in a safe place, only for the tide to trap it behind a wall of coral. A mother bonobo in the Congo teaches its son the skills it will need to survive adulthood, bison protect their calves from the ever-present threat of wolves and a mother zebra has to lead its foal across a dangerous river.(n)

programme.title: Dog's Best Friend
programme.desc: Documentary exploring canines' friendships with other creatures from the animal world, beginning with a dog that swims with dolphins.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Monkeys Revealed
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin explores the world of primates, from strange lemurs and acrobatic monkeys to enigmatic apes. He uncovers the secrets of the primates' success - their survival tactics and physical adaptations - and how their lives mirror those of their human cousins. He begins by meeting an orang-utan that uses soap to improve its personal hygiene, baboons with a taste for flamingos, criminal-minded macaques and fluorescent mandrills that don warpaint before going into battle.(n)

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: An exploration of Australia's underwater ecosystem, one of the natural wonders of the world and the largest living structure on the planet. In the first of three programmes, marine biologist Monty Halls examines the complex form of the coral reef itself and the wildlife that lives on it, from deadly fish-hunting snails and sharks that can walk on land to fighting corals and parrotfish, which cocoon themselves every night.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Muckle Flugga in the Shetlands to the Old Man of Hoy on Orkney. Historian Neil Oliver investigates the story of the freedom fighters who undertook missions in Nazi-occupied Germany during the Second World War, while anthropologist Dr Alice Roberts examines a mysterious skeleton that reveals intriguing clues as to the lifestyle of ancient Shetlanders.(n)

programme.title: Why Sharks Attack
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the unusual spate of deadly shark attacks that have gripped Australia in recent years. Do the creatures purposely target humans, or is each assault a tragic case of mistaken identity? Plus, a look at how great white sharks have begun appearing in growing numbers off the beaches of Cape Cod, Massachusetts - where they have rarely been seen for hundreds of years.(n)

programme.title: Monkeys Revealed
programme.desc: Zoologist George McGavin explores the world of primates, from strange lemurs and acrobatic monkeys to enigmatic apes. He uncovers the secrets of the primates' success - their survival tactics and physical adaptations - and how their lives mirror those of their human cousins. He begins by meeting an orang-utan that uses soap to improve its personal hygiene, baboons with a taste for flamingos, criminal-minded macaques and fluorescent mandrills that don warpaint before going into battle.(n)

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: High-definition cameras and aerial photography techniques are used to explore the archipelago, which is rich in wildlife and made famous by Charles Darwin's On the Origin of the Species. This programme focuses on the geological history of the islands through the evidence of volcanic eruptions and examines what makes it unique. Tilda Swinton narrates.(n)

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough presents an exploration of Earth's vast seas, which cover 70 per cent of the planet's surface. In the first episode, millions of squid appear off the coast of California, gannets, whale sharks and dolphins hunt migrating sardines in the Indian Ocean, and thousands of turtles make the annual pilgrimage to lay their eggs in Costa Rica.(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Brad Pitt star in David Fincher's Oscar-nominated drama, the former as a bored executive, the latter as a stranger he meets on a plane who introduces him to a world of ennui-alleviating physical pain: Fight Club, a semi-secret organisation where men vent their frustrations in bare knuckle fighting in dingy basements. But as Norton becomes more involved, he learns more about the shadowy organisation that plans to take on more than each other..(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: All-action adventure spiced with humour in which a retired Special Forces colonel returns to action when a ruthless South American dictator kidnaps his 11-year-old daughter. Armed to the teeth, he sets out to bring her back, leaving a trail of destruction(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: The mysterious fifth element when combined with four others creates the ultimate weapon against universal evil. The story begins in 1914 when benign aliens visit an ancient Egyptian temple to steal four stones containing information about this mysterious element. The visitors promise to return to Earth in the future to save it from evil. Three centuries pass and Earth is threatened by a thunderous Cosmic Evil. Unfortunately, the Evil killed the Good aliens who promised to save the planet. Fortunately, Earthlings have a piece of one of the alien saviors. Utilizing DNA restructuring, scientists grow the piece into a perfect new alien which takes the form of a curvaceous, seductive no-holds barred redheaded acrobat who escapes from the lab with the police in hot pursuit. Desperately she dives into a cab reluctantly driven by luckless former special force officer (Bruce Willis) who suddenly finds himself faced with the task of saving the universe by finding the missing stones and vanquishing the evil forces. Featuring dazzling special effects and classy production values coupled with a healthy splash of outlandish high fashion the emphasis of Besson's film is not so much plot as it is over-the top spectacle(n)

programme.title: In Her Shoes
programme.desc: Chalk 'n' cheese sisters Cameron Diaz and Toni Collette fall out over a man. Can long-lost gran Shirley MacLaine bring them back together? Comedy drama. Sexual references(n)

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: A stranger defies the local cattle baron and his sadistic son by working for one of his oldest rivals(n)

programme.title: True Lies
programme.desc: A special agent called Harry Tasker skilled in languages and counter intelligence has been leading a double life all his married life. His wife believes that he works for a computer company until she becomes involved with a con artist who likes seducing married women...(n)

programme.title: Commando

programme.title: The Abyss
programme.desc: The civilian crew of a drilling station are called in to save sailors in a nuclear submarine stuck on the seabed of the Atlantic. But they aren't the only ones interested in the lost sub. Deep sea chiller(n)

programme.title: Total Recall
programme.desc: Construction worker Douglas Quaid opts to enjoy a virtual holiday via implanted memories but the procedure awakens recollections of a former identity leading him on a dangerous mission to Mars(n)

programme.title: Commando

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: Steven Spielberg's masterwork deals with the Holocaust, but the Holocaust on a personal level -- how one man's morality and humanity changes in the face of unmitigated horror. As the film's tagline aptly sums it up: "Whoever saves one life, saves the entire world." The film begins in Krakow, Poland in 1939. Oskar Schindler (Liam Neeson), an imposing, well-dressed bon-vivant is seen buying drinks and caviar for Nazi officers, who permit him to open up a clay-pot factory, enlisting cheap labor provided by Jewish refugees. Schindler asks Itzhak Stern (Ben Kingsley), a Jewish accountant, to help him obtain backing for the factory. By 1941, the Jewish community has been herded into the Ghetto, and the elders agree to back Schindler, reasoning that having a job might guarantee the Jews a reprieve from death in the concentration camps. But, by 1943, the Ghetto is being liquidated, and the remaining residents are brought to the Plaszow Forced Labor Camp. The commandant, Amon Goeth (Ralph Fiennes) is a cold-blooded Nazi sadist, who at the same time is attracted to Jewish inmate Helen Hirsch (Embeth Davidtz), whom he makes his maid. When the time came for his unpaid Jewish workers to be sent to their deaths, Schindler was able to rescue over a thousand of them by placing them on his special list of "essential" workers and by befriending Goeth and using his friendship to campaign for their reprieve(n)

programme.title: The Medallion
programme.desc: Fast-paced fantasy action comedy about Hong Kong cop Eddie Yang (Jackie Chan), who is mysteriously transformed into an invincible warrior after an incident with a mysterious medallion. When Yang goes in search of the secrets of the magical charm, he has to confront the evil Snakehead (Julian Sands). But Yang is supported by tough British Interpol agent Nicole (Claire Forlani), who knows how to take care of herself(n)

programme.title: What's the Worst That Could Happen?
programme.desc: This polished caper comedy, based on a Donald E. Westlake novel, pits a professional thief (Martin Lawrence) against the white-collar criminal (Danny DeVito) who stole a prized ring from him. The topnotch supporting cast includes John Leguizamo as Lawrence's partner in crime and comedian Bernie Mac as Lawrence's fence, Uncle Jack. Carmen Ejogo, Glenne Headly, William Fichtner, Larry Miller(n)

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: A disgraced military defense contractor (Bradley Cooper) is rehired by an old boss to oversee the launch of a weapons satellite in Hawaii. Upon his arrival he reconnects with an old love (Rachel McAdams) but finds himself becoming increasingly attracted to an Air Force pilot (Emma Stone) assigned to watch over him(n)

programme.title: Accidental Love
programme.desc: A waitress starts behaving strangely after she gets a nail stuck in her skull. Later, she falls for a dim-witted senator during a trip to Washington, D.C(n)

programme.title: Windtalkers
programme.desc: Two U.S. Marines in WWII are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher(n)

programme.title: Steel Magnolias
programme.desc: Robert Harling adapted and expanded his stage hit, a character study set in small-town Louisiana that celebrates friendship among a group of strong-willed women who discuss their lives—especially the shortcomings of their men—at Truvy's beauty salon. Julia Roberts earned her first Oscar nomination as Best Supporting Actress for her portrayal of stubborn Shelby. Harling costars as the minister(n)

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: A disgraced military defense contractor (Bradley Cooper) is rehired by an old boss to oversee the launch of a weapons satellite in Hawaii. Upon his arrival he reconnects with an old love (Rachel McAdams) but finds himself becoming increasingly attracted to an Air Force pilot (Emma Stone) assigned to watch over him(n)

programme.title: White Men Can't Jump
programme.desc: Top script, sharp moves and colourful performances from Wesley Snipes and Woody Harrelson on and off the basketball courts of Venice Beach(n)

programme.title: The Peacemaker
programme.desc: A pair of mismatched government operatives must recover stolen nuclear warheads from international terrorists. When missiles being transported on a Russian train are supposedly destroyed, a brash army specialist is teamed with an ambitious female executive. They soon learn a grudging respect, as the hunt for the weapons takes them across Europe and culminates in a tense Manhattan showdown(n)

programme.title: Desperate Measures
programme.desc: Barbet Schroeder directed this thriller about San Francisco police officer Frank Connor (Andy Garcia) who hopes to save his terminally ill son Matt (Joseph Cross) by locating a compatible bone marrow donor. The potential donor turns out to be convicted murderer Peter McCabe (Michael Keaton), who anticipates the trip to the hospital as an ideal chance to escape. When McCabe makes his move, the hospital becomes a battleground, and Connor is put on the spot: He must pursue and protect the psycho killer who is his son's only hope for survival(n)

programme.title: Fight Club
programme.desc: Edward Norton and Brad Pitt star in David Fincher's Oscar-nominated drama, the former as a bored executive, the latter as a stranger he meets on a plane who introduces him to a world of ennui-alleviating physical pain: Fight Club, a semi-secret organisation where men vent their frustrations in bare knuckle fighting in dingy basements. But as Norton becomes more involved, he learns more about the shadowy organisation that plans to take on more than each other..(n)

programme.title: Existenz
programme.desc: A video-game designer is trapped in one of her own creations in David Cronenberg's foray into the world of virtual reality(n)

programme.title: Strange Days
programme.desc: Dark, futuristic thriller, set on the eve of the new millennium, about a black-market trader who deals in stolen dreams. An ex-LA cop decides that any experience can be recorded - via a headset device originally developed for the police - and sold. When one of his workers is killed, he is plunged into a maze of paranoia and deception - and uncovers a conspiracy that threatens to blow LA apart(n)

programme.title: The River Wild
programme.desc: Experienced rafter Gail is introducing her family to the river she grew up on, when two dangerous strangers throw their vacation into jeopardy. Tense drama(n)

programme.title: Miami Blues
programme.desc: Thriller in which Fred Ward plays a Miami cop who finds a case to take his mind off his personal problems when a sociopath steals his gun and badge and embarks on a crime spree in the city(n)

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: A giant shark is feeding on the good people of Amity Island and it's up to police chief Martin Brody to hunt down the finned fiend(n)

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: Having recovered from the grisly events of four years ago, Amity Island is once again packed with tourists. Families are sailing in the bay and swimming off the beach, but when two divers and a water-skier go missing, the local police chief fears that he is about to relive his greatest nightmare(n)

programme.title: Kickboxer
programme.desc: A martial arts student trains to become the ultimate kickboxer, determined to exact revenge on the brutal champion who paralysed his brother during a fighting contest(n)

programme.title: Sniper
programme.desc: A sergeant and a sharpshooting bureaucrat aim to extinguish a guerrilla leader(n)

He befriends the brutal crime lord, gaining his trust in order to get close enough to exact revenge(n)

programme.title: Bruce Lee, the Legend

programme.title: Earthquake
programme.desc: The tales of multiple people are interwoven in the wake of a catastrophic cataclysm in Los Angeles. Survivors attempt to reach safety and find loved ones as the LA landscape crumbles(n)

programme.title: Hot Shots! Part Deux
programme.desc: In the eagerly anticipated sequel, directed by Jim Abrahams, Charlie Sheen returns as Topper Harley. Sickened by his life of violence, Topper retreats to a mysterious Eastern monastery. But when he's asked to head a mission to free the Desert Storm PoWs, he takes up arms again. In what is largely a spoof of the Rambo movies, he's joined by Ramada Hayman, who had previously dumped him, but she must also fight the charms of CIA op Michelle Huddleston (Brenda Bakke). When they've finished, the MIddle East will never be the same again... Edited for content. Premiere(n)

programme.desc: Rollercoaster action thriller starring James Caan and Robert Duvall as two secret agents and friends who are part of a private organisation who end up as bitter enemies intent on killing each other(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother
programme.desc: Everyone knows it takes an Undercover Brother to foil The Man. This time, The Man has launched Operation Whitewash, a plot to undermine an African-American general's presidential ambitions. But with the Undercover Brother (Eddie Griffin) on the case, alongside his sexy sidekick, Sistah Girl (Aunjanue Ellis), the general is sure to see the inside of the Oval Office. The 70's fashion-fabulous duo dons the latest in country club attire to infiltrate The Man's plan and root out his evil accomplice the White She Devil (Denise Richards)(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers from the Nye County Sheriff's Office pull over a vehicle for a missing headlight, but end up busting driver for possession of illegal substances.(n)

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Pahrump, Nevada are forced to lay down road spikes to halt a runaway vehicle, while in Florida, police seek to break up a fight between neighbours.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. First lieutenant Michael Torres gets involved in a fight before falling to the ground, and is found beaten to death the next morning. The only witness is his friend and colleague Captain Joe Westcott, who suffers from post-traumatic stress disorder and has trouble distinguishing reality from his past military experiences in the Middle East.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part two of two. Tony reviews satellite footage of rebel forces in the Middle East and spots Kersey among a group of insurgents, concluding that Joe Westcott's fear of him was well-founded. Back at HQ, Abby creates a 3D computer model of the attack that occurred in Afghanistan and Joe dons a virtual-reality headset to relive the traumatic events. Will it jog his memory?.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Teenager Lydia Wade manages to escape a gang of masked men trying to abduct her and her friend Rosie, the daughter of a US Navy commander. Lydia's Navy captain father David Wade was shot dead during the attack and her mother is overseas, so Ziva offers to look after the girl, while Abby tries to jog her memory by creating facial reconstructions of the attackers based on some grainy CCTV footage. DiNozzo and McGee find links on Rosie's laptop to possible suspect John `Diesel' Stevens.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to the scene when there is an attempt on the life of FBI agent TC Fornell, with the assailant identified as Navy seaman Tyler Brown. The pair team up and visit the bar where Brown worked and bump into their mutual ex-wife Diane Sterling, who was operating undercover as an employee suspected of stealing customers' identities. Joe Spano and Melinda McGraw guest star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Gibbs and the team investigate and find the victim died three or four weeks earlier, and an unusual $100 bill in his wallet proves to be a vital clue. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Red John strikes again just as Jane narrows down the list of people who could be the serial killer to seven suspects, and the subsequent investigation uncovers a link between the victim and the CBI consultant. Guest starring Laura San Giacomo (Saving Grace, Pretty Woman), with Simon Baker.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Detective drama series, starring Kyra Sedgwick as Deputy Chief Brenda Leigh Johnson, who heads the Priority Murder Squad, a special unit of the LAPD handling sensitive, high-profile murders. In her first case since arriving in Los Angeles, Brenda uncovers a disastrous love affair and a mysterious past as she investigates a death at the home of a multi-millionaire computer company executive.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a high-profile model, killed with the unusual weapon of poisoned hair conditioner. While suspicion initially falls on the victim's film-star husband, the case proves more complicated than expected. The detective is also reunited with an old boyfriend.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. She accepts the help of a retired marine colonel when he comes forward with information about the murders - but begins to believe he knows more than he is letting on. Drama, with Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An operation to apprehend a businessman guilty of using terror to manipulate the stock market is compromised, until Bishop and Qasim join forces to find a break in the case.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs assumes a former alias to infiltrate an infamous anti-government militia. Meanwhile, Bishop and Reeves team up in an off-the-books investigation.(n)

programme.title: Bull
programme.desc: An attorney for one of Bull's former clients, Liberty Davis, asks him to consult on a couple's civil suit against a teacher who had a sexual relationship with their son.(n)

programme.title: The Walking Dead
programme.desc: The Saviors visit the Hilltop unexpectedly, surprising everyone with plans of taking more than just supplies.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter, Joe, Cleveland and Quagmire help throw Jesus an important birthday party after running into the Son of God at the Quahog Mall. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family, with the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: Stewie, Chris and Brian's Excellent Adventure.
programme.desc: Stewie and Brian use their time machine to help Chris pass his history test so he does not have to re-sit the whole year, but trouble ensues when the trio all get stuck in the past.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is awarded a prestigious job as a sniffer dog for the Quahog police department, only to suffer the embarrassment of becoming addicted to cocaine and referred to a rehabilitation clinic.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. Brian moves into his cousin Jasper's Hollywood apartment and tries to start a career in screenwriting. Things are slow taking off, and he spends some time washing cars and working as a waiter to make ends meet. When his break finally comes, it is not quite what he had in mind.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Stan creates a clone of Steve, and takes the opportunity to challenge Francine to a parenting competition in which they each raise one of the teenagers to determine who has the better child-rearing skills. Meanwhile, Roger tries to find a missing bride and groom in Thailand.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.sub-title: The Best Little Horror House in Langley Falls.
programme.desc: A battle between Stan and Buckle breaks out when they try to outdo each other with their Halloween decorations. Animated comedy, with the voices of Seth MacFarlane and Scott Grimes.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg tries to get friendly with the in-crowd at school, but becomes the target of their cruel mockery. Peter competes against Chris in a variety of winter pursuits, including a skating race and the unusual `kitchenware on face and head' contest - but there is a surprise in store for him.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter is struck by lightning and hovers on the brink of death. In his state of limbo he experiences flashbacks that make him realise he should pay more attention to his beloved wife. At the same time, he agrees to arrange a date for Death with the girl from the pet shop. Peter Frampton guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois becomes a martial arts expert and puts her new-found skills to use by chasing away tourists watching the leaves fall in Quahog. Unfortunately her zeal for combat soon infects the entire Griffin household, leading to an all-out family brawl.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.sub-title: The Kiss Seen Around the World.

programme.desc: Stan is delighted when Roger offers to help him open a restaurant, but their differences of opinion wreak havoc. Elsewhere, Steve sees an opportunity for romance when the new girl at school invites him over while her parents are out of town.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: Detective Ryan Fields is killed in the island community of Broad Channel in Queens, where Nichols and Stevens are told by Rodgers that the victim met his death by a bullet to the head after his Kevlar vest stopped the first three shots. Also investigating is Internal Affairs captain Zoe Callas (Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio, joining the cast), who discovers that Fields' mobile phone records show a number of conversations with Jackie Dooley - a crime boss Nichols has been after for years.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates the murder of a Russian prostitute - and discovers some very famous names on her list of clients. When one of the prime suspects is given an alibi by the FBI, she discovers he is a pawn in a larger investigation. The detective also struggles with her feelings for Fritz.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda looks into a series of gang shootings that appears to have been carried out by a military sniper. She accepts the help of a retired marine colonel when he comes forward with information about the murders - but begins to believe he knows more than he is letting on. Drama, with Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives hunt a killer responsible for murdering hospital patients by lacing pain medication with cyanide. Starring Vincent D'Onofrio and Kathryn Erbe.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: After a reporter and his fiancee are gunned down outside a restaurant, Goren and Eames are given a seemingly reliable eyewitness description of the killer. However, while on the trail of their suspect, they discover the journalist was planning to publish an expose on corruption within the sanitation industry, taking their investigation in an entirely new direction.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs is called to the scene when there is an attempt on the life of FBI agent TC Fornell, with the assailant identified as Navy seaman Tyler Brown. The pair team up and visit the bar where Brown worked and bump into their mutual ex-wife Diane Sterling, who was operating undercover as an employee suspected of stealing customers' identities. Joe Spano and Melinda McGraw guest star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Returning from a six-month posting in the Gulf, Navy lieutenant commander Megan Huffner opens her front door to find her husband Noel dead in his chair. Gibbs and the team investigate and find the victim died three or four weeks earlier, and an unusual $100 bill in his wallet proves to be a vital clue. Meanwhile, Tony's father visits for Christmas and looks to rebuild their fractured relationship. Guest starring Robert Wagner.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: An investigation is launched into the murder of a psychiatrist involved in the trial of a drug designed to treat teenage depression and anxiety. Meanwhile, Brenda's squad learns she was charged with sexual misconduct in her previous job in Atlanta. Detective drama, starring Kyra Sedgwick.(n)

programme.title: The Closer
programme.desc: Brenda investigates when the daughter of a congresswoman is raped and murdered in her home, and is drawn into a seedy underworld. The evidence prompts her to examine the victim's sexual predilections - and uncovers a secret that could make her the next victim. Kyra Sedgwick stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: A plastic surgeon reports the disappearance of his wife, and Goren suspects there is more to the case than meets the eye, but struggles to find any flaws in the doctor's alibi. When body parts are found washed up on a beach, the detectives set a trap, placing a story in the papers claiming this could be the missing woman, to see how her husband reacts. Donna Hanover guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the death of a banker in a fire at his office. Discovering the sprinklers were disabled, Goren and Eames suspect arson. They track down the man who started the blaze - but he is killed while resisting arrest, leaving them with no clues as to who hired him. Vincent D'Onofrio, Kathryn Erbe and Jamey Sheridan star.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. A man and his son on a fishing trip hook what appears to be the body of a petty officer, but the dead man turns out to be a journalist who had been investigating the proliferation of drugs in the Navy. Meanwhile, Ziva returns to her car after a workout at the gym to find her father Eli hiding inside. Guest starring Michael Nouri.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Conclusion. After the deaths of two family members of NCIS employees, the team identifies the killer as a Swedish mercenary and the ballistics report reveals the bullets came from an Iranian arms dealer. McGee traces a wire transfer made to the hitman's ex-wife and son to an account under the name Virtue, and Ziva makes a connection after realising what the Hebrew translation is.(n)

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: Jack Black stars in this take on Jonathan Swift's 1726 novel, though director Rob Letterman's family-friendly version tones down the satire and concentrates just on Gulliver's early adventures. Lemuel Gulliver works in the post room of a New York newspaper. Spying an opportunity to impress the beautiful editor Darcy Silverman, he stoops to plagiarising travel websites in order to win a commission to write his own travel piece. He succeeds, but his reward is an assignment to the Bermuda Triangle, where he inevitably vanishes without trace. Gulliver wakes up on the shores of an island that's home to a nation of tiny people who appear to be stuck in the 18th century. And they aren't at all sure what to do with this gargantuan beast that Providence has washed up among them. The Lilliputian cast include Billy Connolly, Catherine Tate, Chris O'Dowd, Emily Blunt and James Corden(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moaning Lisa. Lisa Simpson (voice of Yeardley Smith) is used to being a misfit, but one day she finds herself overcome by feelings of depression, and nothing she does seems to make her feel better. Marge (voice of Julie Kavner) is concerned, but can't seem to figure out what the matter is, and urges her daughter to ignore her feelings and put on a happy face. Lisa, however, makes friends with local jazz musician Bleeding Gums Murphy (voice of Ron Taylor), who shows her how to work out her bad feelings by playing the blues. Marge, however, isn't so sure that playing blues riffs will really help Lisa in the long run. Meanwhile, Homer (voice of Dan Castellaneta) has problems with Bart (voice of Nancy Cartwright), who has been subjecting Homer to a series of "defeats -- correction, humiliating defeats" on their video boxing game; Homer is convinced he has to start winning if he wants to regain the respect of his son. "Moaning Lisa" first aired on February 11, 1990(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Rosebud. Elderly nuclear power magnate C. Montgomery Burns (voice of Harry Shearer) is celebrating his birthday, but while his loyal assistant, Waylon Smithers (also voiced by Shearer), stages a very special party, complete with international dignitaries and an appearance by the Ramones, Burns is still unhappy. Lately, Burns has been pining for the teddy bear he had as a child, Bobo, and he won't be happy until he can recover the toy. Smithers is put on the project, but the bear soon turns up in a very unlikely place -- in a bag of ice purchased by Homer Simpson (voice of Dan Castallaneta). Homer gives the teddy bear to his baby daughter, Maggie, and when Homer learns that there's a very valuable old teddy bear in his home, he discovers that Maggie doesn't want to give up her new teddy. Burns offers Homer a large sum of money for the bear, but Homer is forced to turn it down when Maggie refuses to give up the bear; angry, Burns then tries to force Homer to give up the bear by cutting off his supplies of beer and television, and eventually Burns and Smithers plan an elaborate plot to steal the bear. "Rosebud" first aired on April 18, 1993(n)

Oscar-winning animated comedy, with the voices of Johnny Depp, Isla Fisher and Bill Nighy.(n)

Peter Weir's drama, starring Ed Harris, Colin Farrell, Saoirse Ronan, Jim Sturgess and Mark Strong.(n)

The boy grows up to become a directionless slacker, with the foul-mouthed living toy still his inseparable friend - but his girlfriend thinks it is time for him to grow up. Comedy, starring Mark Wahlberg and Mila Kunis, directed by and featuring the voice of Seth MacFarlane.(n)

programme.title: The Stag

Comedy, starring Hugh O'Conor, Andrew Scott and Peter McDonald.(n)

Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jeff Bridges, alongside Maggie Gyllenhaal, Colin Farrell and Jack Nation.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: An entrepreneur leaves his pet in Rebecca's apparently capable hands, but Sam jeopardises her job by letting it escape. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Cliff's loyalties are divided when his postie girlfriend commits a mail offence on his behalf. Comedy, starring John Ratzenberger.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren has a bad day - a convict escapes in the fog on his way to Strangeways, the blood donor van turns up at the factory, and Tony's holiday photos cause upset. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Andrew Dunn.(n)

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff have a bet on Bren's chances of romance with Tony, but the hapless cook's past finally catches up with her and threatens to ruin any prospects of romance. Meanwhile, Stan is furious with Philippa for failing to save the bulbs from last year's Christmas tree lights. Comedy, written by and starring Victoria Wood, with Thelma Barlow, Andrew Dunn, Celia Imrie and Shobna Gulati.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.(n)

programme.title: Boomers
programme.desc: The friends gather for Joyce's retirement party, where John has made a tribute video - but forgotten to ask Trevor for his contribution - and Maureen latches onto a trendy young couple. Alan also has bad news that might ruin proceedings - unless the guest of honour spoils it first by confronting her neighbour about her kids' unruly behaviour. Alison Steadman and Philip Jackson star in the sitcom, with Russ Abbot, Stephanie Beacham, Paula Wilcox and James Smith.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch discovers fellow inmates at Slade Prison are planning an escape over Christmas - and is so convinced the bid is doomed to fail that he takes refuge in the hospital so he cannot be blamed when the tunnel is found. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1975, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.(n)

programme.title: Look Who's Talking
programme.desc: Pregnant Mollie is dumped by her boyfriend, and sets out after the baby's birth to find a surrogate father for her infant son Mikey, who comments on proceedings through a wisecracking inner monologue. Mikey is confident the cab driver who helped deliver him is the perfect man for the job - but his mother is less than convinced. Comedy, with John Travolta, Kirstie Alley and the voice of Bruce Willis.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The disappearance of an illicit tin of pineapple chunks leaves the inmates horrified that there is a thief in their midst - and for a while, no one is above suspicion. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber is feeling dejected after his romantic fortunes take a turn for the worse, so Fletch tries to revive his friend's flagging spirits. However, his cunning plan has one potential drawback - it involves his own daughter. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher and the rest of Slade's inmates take advantage of the relaxed atmosphere - and of Barrowclough - with Mackay away on holiday. Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale star.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark invites his parents over for Christmas lunch, and plans everything down to the last detail - but Jeremy becomes over-excited, then Dobby and Super Hans turn up uninvited. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark finds himself wallowing in depression about Dobby on New Year's Eve, but Jeremy is determined that the `El Dude Brothers' are going to enjoy the night of their lives. Comedy, starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: A month after asking Dobby to move in with him, Mark is still waiting for Jeremy to leave and is becoming increasingly jealous of his girlfriend's visits to the permanently ill Gerrard. Jeremy decides to visit a therapist, Mark gets a job and things begin to take a positive turn - until a tragic event affects them both. Comedy starring Robert Webb and David Mitchell, with Isy Suttie and Jim Howick.(n)

programme.title: Peep Show
programme.desc: Mark feels the need to impress Dobby and gets a lucky break when his book Business Secrets of the Pharaohs is accepted by a publisher. Jeremy enrols on a life-coaching course, but things become complicated when he sleeps with his tutor. Comedy, starring David Mitchell and Robert Webb.(n)

programme.title: Psychoville
programme.desc: Jeremy resorts to desperate measures as he continues the search for the missing library book, while a number of people have it in for Mrs Wren and only one man can save her. Comedy thriller, starring Reece Shearsmith and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: Psychoville
programme.desc: Tealeaf and Peter Bishop join forces to solve the mystery of the locket, but as danger mounts, things do not go to plan. Mr Jelly once again takes on Mr Jolly's role, with unexpected results. Comedy thriller, starring Daniel Kaluuya.(n)

programme.title: Psychoville
programme.desc: The secrets of the missing locket are finally exposed and the reality of what is at stake is revealed to those who remain. Dark comedy thriller, written by and starring Reece Shearsmith and Steve Pemberton.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: A keen MP is appointed to the Department of Social Affairs and Citizenship in a Cabinet reshuffle, but she was so far down the food chain that spin doctor Malcolm Tucker did not have a file on her. It also turns out that she has expensive ideas and is about to face the media at a crucial by-election poster launch. Political comedy, starring Peter Capaldi, Rebecca Front and Chris Addison.(n)

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: A database containing the immigration records of more than 170,000 people is accidentally erased, and Nicola and her staff try to keep the news from Malcolm. The minister also has to get through a lunch with journalists without revealing the catastrophic scale of this latest computer disaster - especially as speculation about her future has already begun. Political comedy, starring Rebecca Front and Peter Capaldi.(n)

programme.title: jam
programme.desc: Offbeat comedy featuring bizarre and surreal sketches. Amelia Bullmore, David Cann, Julia Davis, Kevin Eldon and Mark Heap star.(n)

programme.title: Human Remains
programme.desc: Spoof documentary about the dysfunctional relationship between an upper-class couple, whose only common interest is their money and status. Written by and starring Rob Brydon and Julia Davis.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping
programme.desc: A chance to purchase goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody turns on the charm while serving at a party for Kelly, the beautiful daughter of a wealthy Cheers executive in a bid to win her affection. American comedy, guest starring Jackie Swanson, with Woody Harrelson and Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Lilith and Frasier use Carla's six-year-old son as a subject on which to practise their parenting skills. Bar-room comedy, guest starring Jarrett Lennon, with Kelsey Grammer, Bebe Neuwirth and Rhea Perlman.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Tommy Cooper
programme.desc: The frantic funnyman plays tennis in slow motion, demonstrates his cooking prowess and performs his classic `hats' routine.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: After being saved from certain death by the world-famous Thermoman while on holiday, nurse Janet Dawkins doesn't expect to see her saviour again - until an oddball Irish hypochondriac visits her health centre. First-ever episode of the sitcom, starring Ardal O'Hanlon as the Lycra-clad superhero.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet urges George to behave normally when he meets her parents - but his superpowers are likely to cause problems, especially when he starts helping out with the cooking. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon, Emily Joyce, Hugh Dennis and Geraldine McNulty.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy is promoted to the role of Bottom in an amateur dramatic production of A Midsummer Night's Dream. Comedy, starring Ronnie Corbett.(n)

programme.title: Porridge: Inside Out
programme.desc: Series examining the making of the ever-popular prison sitcom, featuring contributions from cast members, writers and fans.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael runs a booking agency for Roger's exclusive use, Susan hopes to take a step up in the literary world by attending a neighbour's book club and Ben stakes a claim on the sofa. Domestic comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is bridesmaid at the wedding of Lionel's father, but nobody is sure who is giving the bride away. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: After being saved from certain death by the world-famous Thermoman while on holiday, nurse Janet Dawkins doesn't expect to see her saviour again - until an oddball Irish hypochondriac visits her health centre. First-ever episode of the sitcom, starring Ardal O'Hanlon as the Lycra-clad superhero.(n)

programme.title: My Hero
programme.desc: Janet urges George to behave normally when he meets her parents - but his superpowers are likely to cause problems, especially when he starts helping out with the cooking. Comedy, starring Ardal O'Hanlon, Emily Joyce, Hugh Dennis and Geraldine McNulty.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: When the Teesdales stop to give Clegg, Compo and Seymour a lift home from their caravanning holiday, Mrs T tries to fight off a feeling of discomfort as it becomes apparent the trio are determined to help park the caravan in their drive. Peter Sallis stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg makes himself scarce after learning Nora, Ivy and Edie want to pair him up with a timid woman who he once knew at school. Peter Sallis stars.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Oh Shut Up and Eat Your Choc Ice.
programme.desc: Japanese tourists spot Seymour and Clegg climbing into a bale of hay, and wonder whether it is a traditional Yorkshire custom. Michael Aldridge and Bill Owen star.(n)

programme.title: My Family
programme.desc: Michael runs a booking agency for Roger's exclusive use, Susan hopes to take a step up in the literary world by attending a neighbour's book club and Ben stakes a claim on the sofa. Domestic comedy, starring Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel at last fulfil their dream and take a romantic trip to Paris - but it seems they are not alone. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Basil goes to great lengths to prove to Sybil that a guest has smuggled a woman into his room. Instead the hotelier keeps being caught in compromising situations with a young Australian woman, and a visiting psychiatrist finds his increasingly manic behaviour both fascinating and alarming. Classic comedy first broadcast in 1979, starring John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: A loud-mouthed, abrasive American comes to stay at the hotel and soon exposes Basil's ignorance of transatlantic cuisine - particularly Waldorf salad. Classic comedy, starring John Cleese, Prunella Scales and Andrew Sachs.(n)

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: The hotel is plunged into chaos by the death of a guest, leading to all manner of mayhem as Basil tries to conceal the corpse from the other occupants. Classic comedy, guest starring Geoffrey Palmer, with John Cleese and Prunella Scales.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: Nana arrives for her Sunday visit, so Jim and the family try to drag themselves away from the TV long enough to eat a hearty lunch - but the lads are still at the pub and the roast potatoes are as hard as bullets. Comedy, starring Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash, Ricky Tomlinson and Sue Johnston.(n)

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: A quiet evening in front of the television is the cause of yet more tension in the Royle household, as Barbara and Jim argue over the programme Changing Rooms, while Denise and Dave have their first ante-natal session. Award-winning comedy, starring Caroline Aherne, Craig Cash and Ricky Tomlinson.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Christmas special from 1999. Linda becomes obsessed with a new idol, and Tom is fed up because his career is in the doldrums. Guest starring Simon Shepherd and Melinda Messenger.(n)

programme.title: Gimme Gimme Gimme
programme.desc: Tom decides to pull his finger out and set up a drama school, having been reduced to selling sushi at the local supermarket - and it seems as though his first pupil will be Linda's sister Sugar, who turns up bragging about her West End debut. Comedy, starring James Dreyfus and Kathy Burke.(n)

programme.title: Home Shopping

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef creates tasty Indian dishes for hectic lifestyles, including tarka dal and chicken biryani, and a mango and raspberry dessert. A group of local football fans try out a recipe at home, and Rachel also meets a friend and spice connoisseur at the Mahon Point market.(n)

programme.title: Rachel Allen's Easy Meals
programme.desc: The chef prepares Mexican huevos rancheros for breakfast, spiced lamb pittas and a zingy Middle Eastern fattoush for late lunch or supper. Rachel also makes cheese with her mother-in-law and cooks for the local lifeboat crew.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Theo Randall serves up comfort food from his home kitchen, including beef bourguignon.(n)

programme.title: My Kitchen
programme.desc: Theo Randall prepares for a dinner party by cooking ravioli with truffle and butter sauce, celery and bottarga, plus hazelnut meringues.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal explores the history of the classic British pudding. He heads back to the early 1600s, when the way to make one was by stuffing the ingredients into an animal's intestine. The chef creates a rice pudding that looks like a hotdog, with a white chocolate mousse bun, pastry-fried onions, sweet soy sauce and saffron mustard, and makes a 17th-century pud involving a cow's udder. He also attempts a giant sponge pudding from the Victorian era and serves it to a specially invited group of teachers and dinner ladies.(n)

programme.title: Heston's Great British Food
programme.desc: Heston Blumenthal delves into the history of iconic British dishes to find inspiration for a culinary salute, beginning with a three-course pie banquet. For his starter, he learns about the `surprise' pies of the 17th century and a dwarf boy who would jump out of one at a grand feast. Heston prepares a gala pie made up of beetroot and horseradish ice-cream in place of meat, with goat's cheese panna cotta, saffron and bacon, and the main course is a gothic affair inspired by Sweeney Todd. The chef also sets out to make the lightest ever mash with an attempt to change the molecular structure of a potato. The dinner is served to a select group of pie-makers 100ft in the air over the East End of London.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.sub-title: Making It Up Isn't Making Do.
programme.desc: Food writer Nigel Slater provides everyday cooking advice, preparing dishes that are uncomplicated and easy to remember, and encouraging viewers to grow their own fruit and vegetables. The first recipes include chicken cakes with herb mayonnaise, free-form trifle with raspberries and custard, bean soup, goat's cheese on garlic toast and tidy Friday pan fry.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer demonstrates how leftovers can be used to prepare tasty meals - using the remains of a Sunday roast and seemingly uninspiring scraps to create dishes including a chicken salad with cous cous and oranges, and potato cakes with a creamy sauce. He also visits allotment holders and is challenged to cook something using the freshest ingredients from their plots.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: Taking inspiration from his vegetable patch, the food writer demonstrates how combinations of ingredients that grow in the same place can make the ideal starting point for a dish. He also visits local allotment holders and uses their produce to create a feast.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer prepares easy recipes with classic ingredients, including sausages and mustard, pork chops with apples and cider, and carrot and coriander fritters. He also visits the Gilmore family and cooks a meal with ingredients from their allotment.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer provides a week's worth of meals using ingredients to create contrasting flavours, including recipes for chicken with lemon and honey, grilled prawns with yoghurt, and mint and pork meatballs with anchovies. He also visits a woman in London who grows her own vegetables.(n)

programme.title: Nigel Slater's Simple Suppers
programme.desc: The food writer rustles up a week's worth of recipes for the winter months, including Moroccan chicken casserole, quick vegetable curry, lamb hotpot and stuffed pumpkins. He also meets a woman and her daughter at their allotment, and prepares a tasty dish with ingredients fresh from the plot.(n)

programme.desc: Actor Stephen Tompkinson, who also provides the voiceover for the series, gets a surprise skull-inspired cake from the team.(n)

programme.title: Choccywoccydoodah
programme.desc: Tom attempts to build a spaceship cake in a very short period of time, while Dave tries to make a wedding cake for 42p.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Life's Too Short star Warwick Davis, Dragons' Den panellist Duncan Bannatyne, adventurer and broadcaster Simon Reeve and former Blue Peter presenter Andy Akinwolere enter the tent. They try their hands at a signature bake of iced biscuits before attempting pastry for the first time and finish with one of the contestants delivering the smallest cake ever seen on Bake Off. Mel Giedroyc oversees proceedings, with Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry judging the celebrities' efforts. Plus, another report from Lorraine Pascale in Ghana showing how the money raised by the charity initiative can make a big difference.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Monica Galetti and Michel Roux Jr oversee proceedings as six chefs battle it out in the quarter-final, preparing a dish of their own invention from a range of ingredients including neck of lamb, rabbit, chorizo and rhubarb. Only four contestants will make it to the next challenge, in which they have to cook two courses for food critics William Sitwell, Tracey MacLeod and Charles Campion - with two going through to the semi-finals.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers examine food found in British woodlands, preparing a wild boar ragu and a creamy fool with brambles picked from a hedgerow. They also explore the long history of poaching in the UK and show which plants can be used to make medicine.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and greengrocer Chris Bavin set out to help families with their food shopping, beginning with the Booths from Lancashire. Mum Jenny claims to be cautious at the supermarket, always looking out for the best deals, but dad Howerd's impulse buys mean they always end up paying more than they should. Now they want to save £40 a week so they can build a home extension. Gregg and Chris start out by spying on the couple during their weekly shop - and are surprised by what they see.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's India
programme.desc: The chef visits a five-star hotel in Madurai, Tamil Nadu, employing local housewives for genuine home-cooked dishes and samples chettinad chicken, a dish inspired by spices brought back from both East and West by merchants. In Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh, he meets India's first MasterChef winner, and marks the end of his culinary journey with a small gathering of friends at his bungalow to reveal the outcome of his search for the perfect curry.(n)

programme.title: The Great Comic Relief Bake Off
programme.desc: Life's Too Short star Warwick Davis, Dragons' Den panellist Duncan Bannatyne, adventurer and broadcaster Simon Reeve and former Blue Peter presenter Andy Akinwolere enter the tent. They try their hands at a signature bake of iced biscuits before attempting pastry for the first time and finish with one of the contestants delivering the smallest cake ever seen on Bake Off. programme.title: Rock and a Hard Place
programme.desc: A chronicle of a 16-week boot camp for incarcerated young people run by the Miami-Dade County Corrections and Rehabilitation Department that aims to make them constructive members of society who are less likely to return to prison. Dwayne Johnson is an executive producer(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Zookeeper's Wife'

The film stars Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Brühl, and is directed by Niki Caro(n)

programme.title: Within

programme.title: Crashing

programme.title: Animals.

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm

programme.title: Fool's Gold
programme.desc: Ben Finn Finnegan is a treasure hunter who has made it his mission in life to track down the Queen's Dowry -- a legendary collection of 40 chests filled with priceless treasure, and lost at sea in 1715. But in his single-minded quest to track down this sizable booty, Finn has sadly neglected his marriage to his loving wife Tess. Tess has grown tired of the hunt, and now she's looking to start her life anew by going to work on the massive yacht of globetrotting billionaire Nigel Honeycutt(n)

programme.title: Criminal
programme.desc: In this taut thriller, a sociopathic death-row inmate is implanted with a deceased CIA agent's memories in an attempt to thwart a deadly plot. At the same time, he reconnects with his own humanity as he bonds with the late agent's family(n)

programme.title: Gods of Egypt
programme.desc: In this epic fantasy adventure, a young thief named Bek enlists the help of the powerful Egyptian god Horus to overthrow the vicious deity Set, who has seized control of the land. Bek's true love has been captured, forcing the mortal rebel to fight back in order to free her and the people of Egypt from Set's tyrannical rule(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip in this incredibly raunchy comedy(n)

programme.title: Sinister 2
programme.desc: In this chilling sequel, two young brothers must defend themselves against a malevolent spirit that feeds on the corruption of innocence, and that documents its exploits in home movies(n)

Samuel L. Jackson gives a charged performance in this drama about a disillusioned teacher who leaves the East Coast after being stabbed several times by a student. He moves to Los Angeles, only to discover that the teens there are just as deadly. John Heard, Kelly Rowan, Clifton Gonzalez Gonzalez, Tony Plana(n)

programme.title: 10,000 B.C.
programme.desc: When a band of mysterious horse-riding warlords raid the Yaghal camp and kidnaps the beautiful Evolet along with many others, young mammoth hunter D'Leh is forced to lead a small group of hunters south to save her. Driven by destiny, the unlikely band of warriors must also battle saber-toothed cats and terror birds(n)

programme.title: The Family Man
programme.desc: In this whimsical romantic comedy that recalls It's a Wonderful Life, Nicolas Cage plays Jack Campbell, a workaholic bachelor who gets to see what his life might have been like had he stayed with his old sweetheart, Kate (Tea Leoni). Thirteen years before, Jack accepted a brokerage internship that marred his relationship with Kate, under the promise that they would only be separated one year. But much later, Jack has become an urban Wall Street exec with no wife or family of his own, and a mysterious proxy (Don Cheadle) offers him the opportunity to step into the life he left behind. After falling asleep in his posh New York apartment, Jack awakens to find himself in bed with his now-wife Kate, daughter Annie (Makenzie Vega), and a new baby, none of which he has ever experienced in his fast-paced single life. After discovering his "real" life has been eliminated, he begrudgingly tries to fit in with his newly appointed life as a family man. The Family Man also stars Saul Rubinek and Jeremy Piven(n)

programme.title: Deadpool
programme.desc: A bizarre experiment transforms a wise-cracking mercenary into a superpowered anti-hero(n)

programme.title: P.S. I Love You
programme.desc: Young widow Holly Kennedy discovers that her late husband has left her ten monthly messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life. Adapted from Cecelia Ahern's best-selling novel. Starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler, Kathy Bates and Lisa Kudrow(n)

programme.title: The Forest
programme.desc: In this haunting thriller, a young woman searches for her twin sister in an infamous Japanese forest beneath Mount Fuji where lost souls go to commit suicide. With the help of an American guide, she treks into the heart of the mysterious woodland(n)

programme.title: The Kingdom
programme.desc: In the aftermath of a deadly attack on American forces in Riyadh, a team of U.S. counter-terrorism investigators finds their attempt to capture the perpetrators stalled by bureaucracy and cultural hostility. Upon enlisting the aid of a Saudi Arabian police officer, the team becomes the target of the perpetrators they are attempting to apprehend(n)

On the day before the Big Game, Albert orders Reynolds to throw the match(n)

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Set amidst the burgeoning Seattle alternative music scene of the early '90s, Singles follows a group of twentysomethings as they try to find love and try to come to terms with their passage into adulthood. Arranged as an episodic comedy, the film follows a group of friends who live in the same apartment building and hang out at the same coffee shop. The central couple is Steve Dunne (Campbell Scott) and Linda Powell (Kyra Sedgwick), a pair who meet at an Alice In Chains concert and eventually fall in love. Singles follows the tumultuous relationship between Steve and Linda and their friendship with Janet Livermore (Bridget Fonda), who is trying to win the affection of grunge-rocker Cliff Poncier (Matt Dillon). The film also has a number of cameos, including actors Eric Stoltz, Tom Skerritt, Peter Horton, director Tim Burton and the film's author/director, Cameron Crowe. From the musical side of the fence, Singles features appearances by Sub Pop executive Bruce Pavitt, musicians Chris Cornell (Soundgarden), Pat DiNizio (Smithereens), Tad (Tad), and Pearl Jam's Eddie Vedder, Jeff Ament, and Stone Gossard, who play Dillon's backing band, Citizen Dick(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Young Vincenzo Cortino, son of a Sicilian postman, travels to America to later become the clumsy chief of organized crime with his sons -- short-fused Joey and educated Anthony. One day, Tony makes a mistake and has to leave town. But when assassins try to do away with his father, he sets out for revenge(n)

This follow up to the international smash hit Bridget Jones' Diary, picks up four weeks later as Bridget already begins to question her romance with the ultra-conservative Marc Darcy. This is a spirited, intelligent comedy that will please audiences on either side of the pond(n)

programme.desc: Jeff Stilson. Jeff Stilson's routine covers a range of subjects, including divorce, men in delivery rooms, and math problems regarding bungee jumping. Taped in San Francisco at the Fillmore Auditorium(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: In Gary Winick's romantic comedy, Kate Hudson and Anne Hathaway star as best friends competing to nab the same location for their wedding reception. When Liv and Emma were girls they attended such an impressive wedding at New York's landmark Plaza Hotel that they swore that, when the time came, they would each celebrate their nuptials there. Twenty years later, after saying 'yes' to their respective fiancés, they've instructed their wedding planner to book the ceremony of their dreams. But because of a clerical error they're both given the same slot - and neither is willing to concede. Instead, their friendship is jettisoned as they resort to underhand tactics in a bid to sabotage each other and fulfil their marriage fantasies..(n)

programme.title: Space Chimps
programme.desc: In Kirk DeMicco's animated film three supersonic simian spacemen take to the cosmos to find a missing probe, and encounter a whole world of trouble along the way. Ham III, the grandson of the first ever chimp in space, is a wise-cracking smart aleck who makes a living being fired from a cannon. When the Infinity Space Probe goes missing, Ham joins a mission to find it. He's been recruited as a PR stunt, but his fellow Space Chimps, Luna and Titan, are highly trained experts. When they crash-land on the planet Malgor, they find a race of aliens who are being oppressed by the tyrannical Zartog, who is using the probe for his own nefarious ends. Can the feckless Ham use his circus skills to save the day, help liberate the aliens, recover the probe, get the girl, and find a way to get back home? This is great fare for all the family, with plenty of deadpan asides to keep grown-ups entertained(n)

programme.desc: British ex-con Wilson arrives in Los Angeles to investigate the mystery of his daughter's "accidental" death. His prime suspect, the wealthy, heavily guarded, music promoter Terry Valentine, is no easy target. Propelled into an increasingly brutal search for truth, Wilson, with single-mindedness and terrifying precision, moves unstoppably toward revenge(n)

programme.title: Terminal Velocity
programme.desc: Deran Sarafian's all-action film stars Charlie Sheen as Richard 'Ditch' Brodie, a skydiving instructor. He's approached by a new pupil, Chris Morrow but while he takes his eye off her, she makes an unscheduled jump that ends in tragedy. Facing a manslaughter charge, Brodie starts his own investigations, only to find himself caught up in a conspiracy involving stolen gold, the Russian mafia and enough bullets and explosions to last him a lifetime(n)

programme.title: The Glass House
programme.desc: This teen psychological thriller marks the feature film debut of respected television producer and director Daniel Sackheim. Leelee Sobieski stars as Ruby Baker, a high school student who is devastated when her parents Grace and Dave (Rita Wilson and Michael O'Keefe) are killed in a tragic car accident. With her younger brother Rhett (Trevor Morgan), Ruby is sent to live with the legal guardians chosen by her parents, their best friends Terry (Stellan Skarsgård) and Erin Glass (Diane Lane). The Glasses live in an opulent Malibu mansion where Ruby and Rhett are promised all of the finest luxuries money can buy and a lavish new rich-kid lifestyle. Before long, however, Ruby begins to suspect that her new caretakers are not what they appear on the surface and that the couple's financial woes may force them to harm her or Rhett in order to cash in on their sizable life insurance policies. The Glass House was written by Wesley Strick, screenwriter of Cape Fear (1991), Wolf (1994), and The Saint (1997)(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: A brother and sister whose drive home from school turns into a heart-pounding race for their lives against one of the most horrifying creatures ever imagined(n)

The senior citizens who found themselves whisked off to the planet Antarea in the first chapter of the saga return for a four-day stopover on Earth to visit their old friends - and to decide whether to return to Antarea or live out their final years amongst their own kind(n)

He's captain of a crew of tiny aliens who man a spaceship shaped like a human-sized replica of him. They've come to Earth to find a way to save their doomed planet. programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'

programme.title: Midnight Special
programme.desc: In this cryptic sci-fi adventure from writer/director Jeff Nichols, Roy (Michael Shannon) rescues his son Alton (Jaeden Lieberher) from a religious cult in Texas, whose members worship the boy for his supernatural powers. Along with a state trooper (Joel Edgerton), the pair go on a cross-country journey as they are hunted by federal agents, who believe Alton might be a threat to national security. Kirsten Dunst, Adam Driver, and Sam Shepard co-star(n)

programme.title: Phantasm II

programme.title: Rushmore

programme.title: Dave Chappelle's Block Party
programme.desc: In September 2004, comedian Dave Chappelle took a break from his immensely successful Comedy Central show to stage a free, unpublicized, all-star hip-hop concert in the Clinton Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn, NY. Inviting fans over the Internet, on the street, and even in his family's hometown of Yellow Springs, OH, Chappelle asked filmmaker Michel Gondry to document the event from its inception on through to the performances themselves. The result is Dave Chappelle's Block Party, a concert film that provides not only a sampling of the music on display that September, but also an intimate look at the comedian himself. Gondry's cameras tag along with Chappelle as he visits Ohio, recruits a university marching band to play at the show, and surveys the opinions of Clinton Hill on the show that's about to take place. Along the way, we're introduced to some the comedian's favorite acts, in rehearsals and on-stage: Dead Prez, Jill Scott, Mos Def, the Roots, Erykah Badu, Kanye West, and the surprise reuniting of the Fugees(n)

programme.title: The Fence
programme.desc: In October 2006, the United States government authorized the construction of a massive fence stretching seven hundred miles along the border separating the U.S. and Mexico. Proponents of the fence claimed that it would help prevent illegal immigration into the United States and foil drug smuggling. However, three years into the construction project, undocumented aliens are still streaming into America through communities divided by the fence, and drug traffic has not been significantly reduced. The fence also runs through a number of Mexican communities, dividing small towns and school campuses thanks to poor planning, and the construction has had a negative effect on the environment of previously unspoiled territories. The fence is ugly, impractical and ineffective -- so why is America still spending billions on dollars on completing a project that's a failure? Filmmaker Rory Kennedy examines the strange history and sometimes comical consequences of the border project in the documentary The Fence; produced for the premium cable network HBO, The Fence received its world premiere at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Suffragette

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Matchstick Men
programme.desc: Ridley Scott directs the crime comedy Matchstick Men, based on the novel of the same name by Eric Garcia. Neurotic con man Roy (Nicolas Cage) suffers from several emotional problems, including obsessive-compulsive disorder. He and his partner Frank (Sam Rockwell) swindle people out of money by posing as money collectors who promise things like tax refunds, package vacations, and other fabulous prizes (which they never get). Frank wants to pull a really big job, but Roy is too consumed with fear and panic attacks to join him. Only cigarettes and his trusty illegal prescription drugs seem to keep him going. When Roy finds himself in desperate need of more pills, he is forced to see legitimate psychotherapist Dr. Klein (Bruce Altman). Roy ends up talking about his emotional damage from a troubled marriage and divorce, which results in the discovery of a child whom he has never met. Dr. Klein suggests that he spend a weekend with the kid, so in walks teenaged Angela (played by twentysomething Alison Lohman). Reluctant to develop his role as a father, Roy also gets heavily involved in Frank's ambitious swindle(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The sought-after contract with Polydor Records becomes ever more tangible a goal as the eight remaining would-be pop icons enter the semi-final. Having survived auditions, the battle rounds, the knockout stage and the quarter-finals, the contestants should be more than a little familiar with the pressures of a live performance. However, with a place in the grand final in the offing, the pressure has never been higher for the singers. As always, coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are on hand to deliver their verdicts on each performer's voice-work, and ultimately cut the number of hopeful stars by half, as only four competitors can progress through to the final.
