programme.desc: England v Lithuania (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents coverage of the Group F clash between the countries at Wembley Stadium. Gareth Southgate's side currently top the qualifying table, but the manager will know his men need to maintain their good form if they are to remain in top spot, with Slovenia - who play Scotland later today - breathing down their necks in second place. The Lithuanians comes into this contest having suffered a 4-0 loss away to Slovakia in their most recent qualifier, but have also claimed a 1-1 draw away to Scotland earlier in the campaign, and could make things difficult for England if they attempt to stymie their attacking play. With commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Glenn Hoddle, and analysis by Ryan Giggs, Lee Dixon and Ian Wright.(n)

programme.title: You've Been Framed

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective is drawn into Newcastle's underworld to discover the identity of a murder victim found dead in the river, with no clue as to who he is apart from a distinctive drugs wrapper. She discovers the dead man had ties to some very dangerous people, many of whom may have wanted him dead, while a witness's testimony links the case to a remote farm where a murder took place 13 years previously. The connection brings Kenny's past back to haunt him, as he was responsible for seeing the perpetrator convicted.(n)

programme.title: International Football Highlights
programme.sub-title: World Cup Qualifier Highlights: England v Lithuania.
programme.desc: England v Lithuania. Action from the Group F clash between the countries at Wembley Stadium, where the teams played each other for the first time in this campaign. The reverse fixture will take place in the final round of matches, and England will hope to be assured of a place in the tournament in Russia prior to that contest, so as to avoid a potential upset. Plus, highlights of Scotland v Slovenia, Northern Ireland v Norway and Republic of Ireland v Wales. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley, Sam Matterface, David Stowell and Joe Speight, and analysis by Paul Ince and Ally McCoist.(n)

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The sought-after contract with Polydor Records becomes ever more tangible a goal as the eight remaining would-be pop icons enter the semi-final. Having survived auditions, the battle rounds, the knockout stage and the quarter-finals, the contestants should be more than a little familiar with the pressures of a live performance. However, with a place in the grand final in the offing, the pressure has never been higher for the singers. As always, coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are on hand to deliver their verdicts on each performer's voice-work, and ultimately cut the number of hopeful stars by half, as only four competitors can progress through to the final. Crime drama, starring Geraldine McEwan, with Simon Callow, Jack Davenport and Tara Fitzgerald.(n)

programme.desc: The first episode of the whimsical rural drama based on HE Bates' novels. Tax collector Cedric Charlton visits the Larkin household intent on getting the head of the family - Pop - to correctly fill out his tax forms. In so doing he falls for attractive daughter Mariette. Starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: No-nonsense teacher Jim Osgood uses his experience of the Territorial Army to impose strict discipline at Ashfordly School, but he goes too far with schoolboy troublemaker Gary Bell and puts him in hospital. Determined to get revenge, the youngster breaks into Osgood's office and steals his gun, leaving Mason with little time to avert a tragedy. Joe McFadden and Lisa Kay star.(n)

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston.(n)

programme.title: Where the Heart Is

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: The son of a high-profile Jewish businessman is attacked in the grounds of a university, leaving Foyle to consider the possibility that the attack was racially motivated. Meanwhile, in London, tensions mount as charismatic right-wing leader Guy Spencer is released from prison. But is he being set up to take the spotlight off a dangerous espionage operation involving MI6? Elsewhere, Sam becomes acutely aware of the impact of the war on Adam's constituents as she encounters a young boy suffering from whooping cough. Michael Kitchen stars in the 1940s-set crime drama, with Honeysuckle Weeks and Daniel Weyman.(n)

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: The documentary going behind the scenes of the airport reveals how staff manage to get hundreds of planes in the air at the correct time. Cameras follow cleaners, ground staff and members of the flight crew as they race to get the world's biggest passenger plane ready for departure. Plus, a royal guest pays a flying visit, and an airport manager tries to defuse a major international protest.(n)

With Joseph McFadden and Paul Jesson.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Mayhem and disorder erupts in the village when stolen loot from a robbery resurfaces.(n)

programme.title: My Uncle Silas
programme.desc: The lovable rogue woos stuck-up Lady Featherstone while doing a spot of grave-digging, then takes his nephew poaching - to disastrous effect. Edward finally meets Mrs Gadsby and cannot help but admire her plump pair of doves. Double bill of the drama series based on the tales by HE Bates, starring Albert Finney as Uncle Silas. With Charlotte Rampling and Lynda Bellingham.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth falls asleep during a flight from Paris to London, while a female passenger is murdered by a poisoned dart, leaving few clues to the killer's identity. Poirot soon discovers she was a money-lender, which may provide a motive for the killing. The investigation is turned on its head, however, when the victim's illegitimate daughter comes forward to claim the inheritance. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with David Firth, Jenny Downham and John Bleasdale.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When the sleuth's dentist is found dead just minutes after he leaves his surgery, Chief Inspector Japp believes it to be suicide - but Poirot has reason to think otherwise and embarks on his own investigation. Drama, starring David Suchet.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The dapper detective accepts an invitation to spend yuletide at the house of an elderly millionaire who seems intent on provoking his money-grubbing sons into murdering him. At first he tries hard to ignore the strained atmosphere and relax - but soon finds himself with a gruesome mystery on his hands. Agatha Christie whodunit, starring David Suchet and Philip Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: An American businessman fears his life is in danger while travelling on the Orient Express from Istanbul to Paris, and offers fellow passenger Poirot $10,000 for protection. After rejecting the proposal, the sleuth wakes up the following morning to learn the man has been stabbed to death while the train was held up by heavy snow in Serbia. Racing against time to find the killer among the passengers, Poirot must look to the past to solve the crime, and is faced with a decision that will haunt him for ever. David Suchet takes the title role in the murder mystery, with guest stars Hugh Bonneville, David Morrissey and Eileen Atkins.(n)

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar return as detectives Cassie and Sunny, who find themselves thrown into another historic murder case with the discover of a body. This time it's the perfectly preserved remains of a middle-aged man found in a suitcase in the silt of a London river. As the detectives begin the complicated task of trying to identify the victim, four unconnected people go about their business - Brighton-based lawyer Colin Osborne, paediatric nurse Marion Kelsey, teacher Sara Mahmoud and respected police officer Tessa Nixon - unaware they are about to be dragged into the investigation. Nicola Walker and Sanjeev Bhaskar star, with Mark Bonnar, Lorraine Ashbourne, Charlie Condou and Wendy Craig.(n)

programme.title: The Americans
programme.desc: Paige struggles to cope with the burdens of knowing the truth, while Philip and Elizabeth now have to work twice as hard to contain their cover without destroying their daughter.(n)

programme.title: The Durrells
programme.desc: Larry falls dangerously ill, and it falls to Theo and his neighbour Sven to put their rudimentary medical skills to the task of saving his life. The family's money worries continue, but Spiros brings them good news from a surprising source. Gerry adds to his growing menagerie, while Margo is emotionally wounded - but gets little sympathy from Leslie.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of eminent lawyer Anaan Kamel is found washed up by an underground river, suspicion falls on Marcus Layton, a former employee of the victim's chambers who was recently fired by her husband Raheel. Text messages suggest an affair that had progressed to blackmail, but Banks and Morton struggle to find further information about Marcus, as his records only seem to date back five years. And when his corpse is found upstream in what looks to be a contract killing, the case becomes much more complicated.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. With Geoff now a marked man, he and daughter Evie are put under watch at a hotel while the search for Mullen is widened. However, when the suspect follows Evie's boyfriend to the location and sets off the fire alarm, he draws Geoff and Evie outside. Meanwhile, Banks believes loan shark Hargreaves is behind the hit on Marcus, and manages to extend his stay in the cell, despite having very little evidence against him. The conclusion of the two-part case, starring Stephen Tompkinson.(n)

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries

programme.title: The Ruth Rendell Mysteries

programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Daisy and Edward are married, but his return to the front line cuts short their happiness. At the station Georgina witnesses the arrival of a train filled with casualties, and decides to do something positive to assist the war effort.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: When a spate of petty thefts culminates in a series of murders at a student hostel, the Belgian sleuth is called in to investigate. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Philip Jackson, Pauline Moran, Damian Lewis and Paris Jefferson.(n)

programme.title: The Halcyon
programme.desc: Drama set in 1940 at a five-star London hotel, showing the impact of the Second World War on families, politics, relationships and work across every social strata. The Halcyon's owner Lord Hamilton holds a secret meeting that attracts the interest of American guest Joe O'Hara, while manager Richard Garland must deal with the arrival of Lady Hamilton a day earlier than expected. Starring Olivia Williams, Steven Mackintosh, Alex Jennings and Matt Ryan.(n)

programme.title: Harlots
programme.desc: Period drama set in London in 1763 following a woman as she struggles to reconcile her roles as mother and brothel owner. Samantha Morton and Lesley Manville star.(n)

programme.title: Victoria
programme.desc: In 1838, at the age of 18, young princess Alexandrina's life is transformed when she ascends the throne of Great Britain and becomes Queen Victoria. As monarch in her own right, the young Victoria suddenly finds herself freed of the repressive shackles placed on her by her mother's advisor, Conroy, and builds a new alliance with the charismatic prime minister Lord Melbourne. However, her inexperience makes her susceptible to mistakes - and ultimately scandal. Period drama, starring Jenna Coleman.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: A Detroit house is overrun by cats, and investigators set off to deal with the situation - but are shocked by the extent of the problem.(n)

programme.title: Animal Cops
programme.desc: A family of puppies suffering from heatstroke and close to death are taken to the Michigan Humane Society.(n)

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of millionaire Bob Harrod, who finally married his childhood sweetheart Fontelle at the age of 81. While she was making preparations to move from Missouri to join her new husband at his California house in July 2009, he vanished from outside the property, and though his car keys were taken the vehicle itself remained in the drive.(n)

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police investigate the death of a man who was found in the driver's seat of his car by a security guard - and suspect he was killed by an illegal hunter.(n)

programme.title: Law on the Border
programme.desc: The PD K9 unit relies on reformed criminals in their battle against the cartel, and they must race to intercept smugglers before they manage to cross the border.(n)

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: In October 1989, the theft of $71,000 from a bank in Noel, Missouri, was accompanied by the disappearance oif its president, leaving police wondering if Dan Short have could have robbed his own bank. Five days later however, his body was found duct-taped to a chair in the Great Lake o' the Cherokees. The tape proved vital in identifying and later convicting two siblings of the crimes.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The 1998 murder of Bobby Sexton, whose body was recovered from an Anderson County Swamp some weeks after his disappearance. His wife Patricia had convinced her lover to kill the father-of-three, even though the pair had recently reconciled and were once again living together.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Florida mother-of-four Andrea White, whose body was found floating in a pond dressed in nightwear. Immediately prior to her death in July 2005, she was in the process of arranging a divorce from her husband David, who was eventually found guilty of the crime.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The case of evangelist Kenneth Richardson, whose body was found floating in the sea at a Florida beach in October 2001 with an arrow piercing his torso. During the investigation it transpired the victim was gay and routinely sought out homosexual liaisons at outdoor locations.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The death of 19-year-old Kathy Bonney, who was shot at close range and her body dumped in Virginia's Great Dismal Swamp in 1987. Her father, Tom Bonney, claimed he feared she would grow up to live a corrupt life, so carried out the murderous act while possessed by an alternate personality named `Hitman'.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The murder of Edith McLeroy, who rebelled against her conservative upbringing in Alabama by marrying the leader of a biker crew. Her tethered body was retrieved from marshes in 1980, but it took 30 years until the mystery of her death was resolved.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: The deaths of two women, whose bodies were discovered in Georgia's Flint River. When investigators managed to link the pair, they were led to the discovery of two more victims, and feared a serial killer was on the loose.(n)

programme.title: Swamp Murders
programme.desc: In October 1989, the theft of $71,000 from a bank in Noel, Missouri, was accompanied by the disappearance oif its president, leaving police wondering if Dan Short have could have robbed his own bank. Five days later however, his body was found duct-taped to a chair in the Great Lake o' the Cherokees. The tape proved vital in identifying and later convicting two siblings of the crimes.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Deadliest Lovers

programme.title: Evil Lives Here

programme.title: Dead Silent
programme.desc: The case of Sean Farmer and Scott Johnston, whose break in a remote campsite in Virginia on a fishing trip was blighted when a mysterious stranger opened fire on them in 2008. programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of retired Michigan police officer Michael Greene and his wife Terri in their home. Police found evidence of a personal grudge as a possible motive for the crime.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-two Sarah Brice hosts the third dinner party in Kingston upon Thames, hoping to impress her guests with her own take on dishes including prawns, lamb and chocolate mousse. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Jamie Baker hosts the fourth party in London, and his ambitious menu of langoustine and crab ravioli, herb crusted rack of lamb, and milloux of chocolate - combined with his choice of evening entertainment - go down well, until an unexpected turn of events scuppers his plans.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retired golfer David Witcher hosts the final evening in Kingston upon Thames, south-west London, and hopes to impress with an American-themed menu, including Wyoming slow-cooked ribs and Louisiana seafood chowder. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Another selection of B&B owners take it in turns as hosts to decide which of their establishments provides the best value for money. The contest begins at Ian and Sam Sugden's Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where the guests are impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms. However, there is some grumbling over breakfast about the bacon.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners stay at Compton House in Newark, Nottinghamshire, which is run by Lisa Holloway - who prides herself on providing a home away from home for her visitors. However, some of the guests have issues with dust and the haddock served at breakfast - and challenge whether a night's stay is worth the price tag.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate welcome their guests to the White Horse, a pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, where they hope an afternoon of morris dancing in front of the cathedral will make a lasting impression. Unfortunately, Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked inside their room by mistake, and there are arguments over tomatoes at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell welcome the contestants to the Old Farmhouse, Cheshire, but everyone is shocked to discover they will have to share a bathroom. Meanwhile, Sam and Ian Sugden find an unwelcome surprise underneath their bed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Payment day arrives, as the guests gather to find out who has won and to thrash out their differences - from some fishy findings to a reminder of why sorry can be the hardest word. Later on, a heated exchange about cleaning ends in tears.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hotel consultant Oli Delaunoy kicks off the week of dinner parties in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, and hopes that his scallop starter and a meaty main course will impress his guests - events-company director Zak Roby, administrator Kim Thomas, house husband Paddy Castledine and nurse Jan Blomer - and win him the £1,000 cash prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nurse Jan Blomer hosts the second dinner party in Cheltenham, Gloucestershire, hoping her menu of chicken with sun-dried tomatoes and home-made ice-cream will win her the £1,000 cash prize. Paddy and Zak's rivalry keeps the evening lively and loud, but the host reclaims the spotlight with a surprising revelation.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events director and bodybuilding enthusiast Zak Roby hosts the third evening in Cheltenham and hopes his polite nature will help him scoop the £1,000 prize. However, a series of confusing party games alongside tricks and posturing at the dinner table mean Zak's quest is far from straightforward.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Australian admin assistant Kimberley Thomas hosts the fourth dinner party in Cheltenham and hopes that an evening of sophistication will win her the £1,000 prize. However, despite her best attempts to create a dignified atmosphere, it does not take long for Paddy Castledine to begin telling rude stories.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Paddy Castledine hosts the final dinner party in Cheltenham, and hopes that his simple menu of locally sourced produce will impress his guests. As the evening draws on, admin assistant Kimberley Thomas tells the host what she really thinks of him, and alpha male Oli Delaunoy is brought to tears, before the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is revealed.(n)

programme.title: Nazi Megastructures
programme.desc: The story of an advanced Japanese battleship that was intended to be the most powerful vessel at sea, but which had to be redesigned as the tide of war turned. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Dougal and Ted get involved in yet another bout of rivalry with their counterparts over on Rugged Island - this time by writing a song that will allow them the dubious honour of representing Ireland in the Eurovision-style music contest Eurosong. Ardal O'Hanlon and Dermot Morgan star.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: Bishop Brennan descends on Craggy Island to investigate rumours that Father Jack has developed the unfortunate habit of sleepwalking in the nude - only to come face to face with his worst fear. Clerical comedy, with Ardal O'Hanlon and Dermot Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: After a chance meeting, Dan goes on a date, but what could possibly go wrong on a simple trip to a restaurant and a nightclub? Meanwhile, Brian connects with his family's past, Jo comes up with an unfathomable new plan for improving her CV, and Aunt Nesta administers her unique brand of tough love. Comedy, written by and starring Greg Davies, following the life of a man with crushing character flaws.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: When another teacher and - more importantly - a rival for Miss Lipsey's affections delivers a smash-hit school assembly for Community Week, Dan conspires to top it all with a brilliant one of his own involving his drama class and a war veteran. Meanwhile, Jo is exploring her artistic side, while Nesta favours an upset Brian over her idiotic nephew. Comedy, co-written by and starring Greg Davies, with Stephanie Cole, Roisin Conaty, Mike Wozniak, Gwyneth Powell and Jeany Spark, and a cameo appearance by the Proclaimers.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Nikki, 50, and her mum Angela, 68, have been involved in a serious car crash. While Nikki, who was driving, is sent for a CT scan with suspected internal injuries, Angela is treated for head wounds and a dislocated elbow. Ellen, 53, arrives with a painfully swollen elbow after falling over in a supermarket, and seven-year-old Jack is rushed to A&E with an open fracture on his arm and a blow to his head after an accident at a wedding.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Yanni's in Seattle, where he clashes with defiant owner Peter Avgoustiou, a chef so set in his ways that he hasn't allowed any changes to his menu since the Greek restaurant opened in 1984. Peter's family is concerned the business is becoming trapped in the past, and standards are slipping, but he seems determined to stick to his guns.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: After a chance meeting, Dan goes on a date, but what could possibly go wrong on a simple trip to a restaurant and a nightclub? Meanwhile, Brian connects with his family's past, Jo comes up with an unfathomable new plan for improving her CV, and Aunt Nesta administers her unique brand of tough love. Comedy, written by and starring Greg Davies, following the life of a man with crushing character flaws.(n)

programme.title: Man Down
programme.desc: When another teacher and - more importantly - a rival for Miss Lipsey's affections delivers a smash-hit school assembly for Community Week, Dan conspires to top it all with a brilliant one of his own involving his drama class and a war veteran. programme.title: Nazi Megastructures
programme.desc: The story of an advanced Japanese battleship that was intended to be the most powerful vessel at sea, but which had to be redesigned as the tide of war turned. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: The team travels the globe to explore the secrets behind more mass-produced food. Jimmy Doherty discovers there's more to traditionally matured cheese than meets the eye, Matt Tebbutt meets a team of researchers to find out why consuming reheated rice can lead to illness, and Kate Quilton heads to Malaysia to look at the production of vanilla extract.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Leighton Buzzard in Bedfordshire to help Richard and Tracy finish restoring a 1968 Morris Traveller for their son Justin.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Five cooks from in and around Harrogate, North Yorkshire, battle to win the £1,000 prize in the culinary contest. First to take on hosting duties is farm girl Jane Steele, who hopes a combination of innovative recipes and fancy wine will win over her guests - horse enthusiast Cassy Bell, photographer Simon Meyer, country gent Alasdair Moore and adventurous punk and cupcake seller Cathy McConaghy.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Horse enthusiast Cassy Bell hosts the second dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, hoping her jockey-themed evening and gastro-pub menu will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cathy McConaghy hosts the third dinner party in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, where she decides to return to her Irish roots and serve a menu of home-made soda bread, cockle soup, oysters, roast lamb, and stout-infused sticky toffee pudding as she vies for the £1,000 prize. However, not all of her guests are impressed with the choice of food being dished up.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Photographer Simon Meyer is the fourth dinner-party host in Harrogate, North Yorkshire. He takes a laid-back approach to the task, but his chicken soup starter goes down so well the guests' comments leave him struggling to retain his composure.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Country gent Alasdair Moore hosts the final dinner party in Harrogate, and hopes to impress his guests with his specially selected wines and `proper' menu. While his monkfish is well received, an early slip-up dents his confidence, and a risky parlour game does not endear him to farm lady Jane Steele. As the evening progresses, his competitors rate their experience, before the winner of the £1,000 cash prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Widow Jenny Kevan seeks to realise her late husband's dream of buying a home near Menton in France. However, she is torn between purchasing a Gallic pad and relocating to Yorkshire to be close to her relatives. Laura Hamilton and Adrian Simpson offer their advice.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman and Jonnie Irwin come to the assistance of Cyndy Bevan, who cannot decide where to spend her retirement, and faces a choice between Lynton in north Devon or Aude in south-central France.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the crew visit the site of a stone structure in Co Durham large enough to hold a full-size football pitch. Over the years, the ruins have been labelled as those of an Iron Age farm, a Roman prison and a Dark Age stronghold. The team aims to solve the mystery and uncover a piece of Britain's heritage.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and his group of intrepid archaeologists head to a muddy field in Wickenby, Lincolnshire, where a metal-detector enthusiast uncovered a treasure trove of Roman and Iron Age coins. As relations become strained between experts with conflicting opinions, the team takes action to discover what was really happening at the location 2,000 years ago.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head over to Denmark, where they embark on their first continental car rescue with a 1968 Volvo Amazon that has been in the same family for more than 45 years.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A family rush their Chihuahua, Darcy, to the clinic after it is hit by a car. For 18-year-old TaJournee, who is autistic, the dog is a lifeline, and Noel must use pins, nuts and bolts to reconstruct the broken pieces of its crushed pelvis. Meanwhile, the vet finds himself in a tricky situation while performing replacement surgery on a seven-year-old spaniel with hip problems, and a Winchester Prison sniffer dog that is lame in both elbows is brought to the surgery.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick and the team deal with two emergency cases in this edition. Lara the cat went missing after jumping into a removal van, but escaped, only to be hit by a car and then attacked by a fox. One of its rear legs is shattered and the vet has to perform reconstructive surgery to rebuild it. Chief, an eight-year-old Northern Inuit, dislocated its hip while chasing a fox. Noel thinks it needs hip-replacement surgery, but owner Nigel can't afford to pay for the operation.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows Matt and Sophie White from Sussex as they build a giant family house of fun for themselves and their children. Going against the norm of designing a serious and practical home, the couple's property features a revolving bookcase door, secret dens, hiding places, one-way mirrors, and a fireman's pole. Matt uses a steel frame system to allow them to change the layout of the property, and other changes include amending the window shapes and sizes, and adding a half floor to create a James Bond room.(n)

programme.title: Vet on the Hill
programme.desc: Scott Miller heads to the Isle of Wight to help with a risky procedure on a Bengal tiger, and he also performs surgery on a donkey with a sinus problem.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The return of the documentary about a pioneering veterinary practice, delving deeper into the science behind the cutting-edge procedures used by Professor Noel Fitzpatrick and his staff. When a dog is brought in with a potentially large tumour in its head, Noel tries something he has never done before, using state-of-the-art technology to design a custom-made implant to replace the part of the skull affected by the cancer. He also tries to cure a terrier's limp by performing an elbow replacement - using a 3D-printed hinged joint.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Betting shop owner Les, 40, is rushed to St George's after losing control of his car on a country road on his way to work. Cambelle, a 21-year-old plumber, has an infected cyst that may require surgery, while 67-year-old retired doctor Patrick is brought to A&E following a horse-riding accident in which he was dragged 130ft and not found for more than two hours.(n)

Despite the overwhelming evidence against Mr. Krabs -- not to mention having been turned down for a long-awaited promotion at the restaurant -- SpongeBob (voice of Tom Kenny) refuses to believe that his boss is responsible and teams up with his best friend, Patrick (voice of Bill Fagerbakke), on a mission to Shell City, where he hopes he can exonerate Mr. Krabs and return the crown to its rightful owner. Of course, this is no easy task; once outside the safety of Bikini Bottom, SpongeBob is faced with the overwhelming dangers of the sea, not the least of which being a cyclops that many believe to be responsible for the deaths of countless other unfortunate sea-creatures who ventured outside county lines. programme.title: Rank the Prank
programme.desc: Hungry Robot. The pesky pranksters are Red Herring (Matthew and Dylan) and Team Blackout (Donavan and Hugo) who team up with stunt performer Devon Slack and prosthetics and make-up wizard CJ Goldman to stage the biggest and best pranks on an unsuspecting public. Teams head to a yoga studio and it's all hands on deck to rig the hidden cameras and special effects required to bring our pranksters' ideas to life. But which team will impress our prank-loving panel of ranksters to win the chance to stage a mindblowing prank on a target of their choice? The reactions are big and the pranks are out of this world when Donavan and Hugo's uplifting Mediation Levitation takes on Matthew and Dylan's spacey Mars Move! For the winning team, the effectors take over a robotics lab and create the most lifelike robot ever built! But when the robot makes a dramatic escape from the lab, will our target be able to stop it?(n)

As the birds nest alongside rivers with thick reeds, they can be tricky to spot, so he dons a pair of waders and keeps an eye out for the elusive animal. Next, he looks for otters in Co Kerry, which proves difficult after a swollen river has washed away their tracks.(n)

Brendan Moar uncovers the living history of Australia's hidden slave trade, Xanthe Mallett dives to a spectacular wreck in search of answers about its calamitous sinking and Tim Flannery is granted rare access to a scientific research zone to examine coral history. At the southern end of the reef, Emma Johnston heads underwater with Google to take images of the reef into homes around the world.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: A man who attempts to run from two patrolling officers in Grimsby, Lincolnshire, only succeeds in leading the pair to a friend of his who is hiding Class A drugs. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Bedfordshire arm themselves with 50,000-volt Tasers when they are called to make a difficult arrest. A lone traffic cop is set upon by a gang of youths in Luton town centre, and a desperate teenager in a stolen car leads police on a hair-raising pursuit. Narrated by Jamie Theakston.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts explores two terraced properties about to be auctioned in West Bromwich and Telford, while Lucy Alexander catches up with the owners of a bungalow in Gillingham in Kent, 18 months after she first visited.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: In East Devon, Martin Roberts visits a flat in Budleigh Salterton that needs a bit of work to get it back in shape, while in Northern Ireland a terraced property in Downpatrick requires a new lease of life. Plus, Lucy Alexander meets the buyer of a plot of land in Abbey Wood, south-east London, who has big plans for its future.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a couple from Wimbledon, south-west London, find a four-bedroom detached home in the Surrey countryside with a large kitchen-diner and a garage suitable for housing a classic car. They also require train links for a commute to the capital and want to be close to a good school, but their budget of £700,000 may not match their extensive wish-list.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton gallops through the Buckinghamshire property market in search of the perfect equestrian home for a young couple who have an £800,000 pounds to work within.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Halifax.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Halifax, West Yorkshire, whose eight-year-old son is paralysed and can only access two rooms in their house. The family home is in need of a major overhaul but with only nine days to complete the job, the gang needs help - and that's where local tradesmen and other members of the community come in, turning up in force to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Misterton.
programme.desc: Since his wife died shortly after giving birth to their sixth child, Paul Makings has been valiantly holding the family together as they grieve. But he's facing even more problems - living in a two-bedroom house he has started to extend, and forced to sleep on the sofa. Nick Knowles and the team are joined by more than 100 locals in Misterton, Nottinghamshire, as they take on their biggest home build ever. However, they have to battle against a blizzard to complete the job in nine days.(n)

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: A couple want to swap their stressful city life, so Jenni Falconer helps them search for a property with a sea view on the Jurassic Coast of southern England.(n)

programme.title: Fantasy Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Phil and Linzi are desperate to relocate to Majorca, where they met and worked together for years. After running a coffee shop in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, for seven years, the pair have decided it is time to relocate permanently to the island. With a budget of £350,000 and two large dogs to accommodate, Jenni Falconer has her work cut out to help the duo secure the ideal coastal property.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Manchester.
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of Manchester couple Rebecca and Steve, whose life was changed for ever when they found out they were expecting triplets. Two years on, Rebecca is becoming depressed by the state of their small, damp, dilapidated house, which is unsafe for the children. The builders have just nine days to bring the property up to date and give this tired mum and dad the space they need for their active offspring. Luckily, local tradespeople and other members of the community turn out in force to help.(n)

programme.title: Obsessive Compulsive Cleaners
programme.desc: Ben spends up to two hours a day cleaning his kitchen hob despite the fact he has only used it once, and doesn't sleep in his bed for fear of creasing the sheets. He heads to Guildford, Surrey, to meet upholsterer and craft enthusiast Gerri, whose home is stuffed with three years' worth of material waiting to be upcycled. Also waging a war on dirt is Sarah, who became obsessed with cleanliness after having her first baby. She travels to Coventry to help brothers Andy and Mikk, but is shocked to find an untidy living room and a wall being used as a dartboard on her arrival.(n)

programme.title: Oxford Street Revealed

Plus, police set out to arrest a homeless man who has his own `place' on the thoroughfare and pop star Nicole Scherzinger shops at HMV.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Bodies

programme.sub-title: Where No Fan Has Gone Before.

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Rapidly rising temperatures threaten all life on Earth, so an emergency conference is convened in Japan. Professor Farnsworth admits responsibility for the crisis, claiming love distracted him from observing proper emission standards on his prototype robot, but the only solution to the problem that anyone can offer involves the destruction of all artificial life - including Bender's. With the guest voice of former US vice-president Al Gore.(n)

programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jay's turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesn't like. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts head Down Under for a family holiday so Phil can fulfil his mother's wish that he should one day return to the country where he was conceived. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The gang members get together to have their family photo taken, with Gloria on hand to organise everyone. and Phil tracks down the record he lost his virginity to, but soon regrets it when it makes him feel as if he's being unfaithful to Claire. programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: How money drove the making of modern Britain, exploring its role in the rebuilding of London following the Great Fire of 1666. The programme investigates how underhanded deals brokered in coffee houses fuelled British prosperity, and exposes how the country profited from dubious practices, including the slave trade, the sex industry and global colonisation. It also explores those who rebelled against the status quo during the period, and discovers how the armed forces countered the threat posed by Napoleon Bonaparte. With contributions by Jeremy Irons, Frank Lampard and Terry Wogan.(n)

programme.desc: When a 10-year-old boy is shot on a New York housing estate, Danny's heated approach to the case lands him in anger-management classes. Meanwhile, Frank has to deal with the State Department and the Turkish government to help a woman avoid persecution and Erin begrudgingly agrees to let Jamie teach Nicky how to drive. Tom Selleck and Donnie Wahlberg star.(n)

programme.desc: Sci-fi drama inspired by Michael Crichton's 1973 film about a futuristic theme park populated by artificial humans, where every human appetite, no matter how noble or depraved, can be indulged. In the first episode, the Westworld scientists begin to notice aberrant behaviour from the park's android inhabitants. Starring Anthony Hopkins, Ed Harris, Evan Rachel Wood and James Marsden.(n)

programme.title: Banshee

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The Withnail & I actor explores Ireland's best hotels, beginning by visiting the beautiful Ashford Castle which provided the setting for the 1952 film The Quiet Man. Together with Classic FM presenter John Suchet, Richard then checks in at the Belfast Europa, which is known as most bombed hotel in Europe after being attacked 28 times during the Troubles, before taking a tour of the Clarence Hotel in Dublin, which is owned by U2 frontman Bono. Finally, he visits the exclusive six-star Ballyfin, where guests are granted the chance to be lord and lady of the manor during their stay.(n)

programme.title: Richard E Grant's Hotel Secrets
programme.desc: The actor's series exploring the world's most luxurious hotels concludes on the glamorous French Riviera. Beginning at the Hotel de Paris in Monaco, he is shown the art of perfect fine dining before meeting ex-Formula One driver David Coulthard, who explains why he chooses to call Monaco home. Richard then visits the Hotel Byblos in St Tropez, where Mick Jagger and Bianca De Macias tied the knot in 1971, before paying a visit to Belles Rivers.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The expansion of Britain's empire through exploration and invention as the Industrial Revolution transformed society and the economy - though the rise of mechanised factories was not welcomed by all. The programme also explores the colonisation of Australia and the advances in 19th-century technology that turned the Crimean War into one of the most brutal conflicts in military history. With contributions by Jessie J, Lily Cole and Dougray Scott.(n)

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)
